Q53QFEySzX7Yjkq3dbkXZA.text: Never bother to have this delivered. Complete slop. I wish I spent $60 on just about anywhere else.

QDg4LYIaglAw4khZXSdtCw.text: My favorite place to go! I could eat there everyday! They have thee best yum yum sauce and my food is almost always delicious. There were a few times where the rice was a little over cooked but overall I'm usually satisfied with the food.

nVL2F69bkHmom-znqjjCRA.text: Nakama is an anomaly. In the heart of Pittsburgh's South Side you will find one of the best sushi restaurants in the US. The place is big, noisy, and a pick up scene at the bar in the evenings, but the fresh sushi and rolls are simply out of this world.   After several visits I was still baffled by how a Japanese restaurant in Pittsburgh could produce the best damn sushi and rolls I'd ever had. I spoke to the Sushi Chef and he explained everything is flown in fresh daily. Then we had colleagues from San Francisco come to town and they were blown away by Nakama's. Finally we had Japanese customers in town for a week so we awkwardly asked them out to eat "sushi in Pittsburgh!". After the meal they said it was the best they had experienced in the US.   I can't wait to get back there soon later this year. Sometimes the ideal visit is a Sunday afternoon sitting at the bar to catch a game and enjoy the great food with a Sapporo. Either way, make this a pit stop when you are in town - you'll be blown away.

CCGZRCZ_EVKme-umxoAW6w.text: Good sushi Diablo noodles were enough for three to share with the veggie egg rolls and ginger salads Service was very good at the bar

Wg9cTanuleG8H8fEweW4gQ.text: Best sushi in pittsburgh!! Came on a Saturday night. Staff was great. Spicy edamame, haiku roll, mature rolls were amazing. Fresh fish. Great sake.

4AnPBMfJw6SsB21l0S_awQ.text: I have read all the negative reviews but I can't offer one. I really enjoyed our last visit. We made a reservation on open table for a Sunday afternoon. We were the first ones through the door. We have only been to the South Side Location.  The restaurant was clean and ready for the day. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our special occasion. It was a Birthday celebration.   I really enjoyed the Hibachi and Loved the sushi. I always order chicken or salmon Hibachi and I try to always get a Philadelphia Inside out roll.  Everything was fresh and prepared to our liking. Hibachi is always great, because you can see what is being made right in front of you.  I am looking forward to finding the food truck!     We received a free appetizer that day, go on the website and give them a little information and they will send you a email for a free appetizer.  Highly recommend for Hibachi Lovers like myself.

iZuLuq07PfulaNKKl0IsCw.text: This was my second visit to Nakama & it was truly a disappointment.  We waited 20 minutes for our sushi to be served and then received someone else's order. We waited for the order to be corrected. I ordered eel & sea urchin sushi. The eel was served cold and the sea urchin was old and slimy. We sat at a table near the bar & had a view of what appeared to be someone's closet. We saw coats on the floor and a tennis shoe protruding out into the restaurant. In addition, there was an industrial bucket sitting on the bar chair with lemons and limes and no cover. My first experience there was amazing. This experience of a dirty restaurant with poor quality sushi has left me with a bad taste in my mouth!

bnnNSGVF5FoNHHkA5s1P-A.text: I've been such a fan of Nakama but lately things have gone down hill. I make a trip to this location once a month/every other month, and have for years. I've noticed some changes for at least the past year. Portion sizes decreasing, prices increasing, and service hitting rock bottom--quality of food is about the only constant.  The food and location are awesome. Food tastes fresh and well made. Being located on East Carson is awesome, easy to get to with valet parking and street parking available.  Now where it drops off; prices of food have steadily inclined whereas portions are decreasing. Once you'd expect to leave with left overs, now you're lucky with 8 pieces of shrimp in your dinner. Also, the cost of something as minor as having fried rice over steamed rice is nearly $4. But it is worth it considering the past two outings the steamed rice wasn't delivered to the table until after the meal was prepared.   Lastly, the service really needs an overhaul. As someone who has experience in the service industry I know how it is and sometimes you're having an off/bad day but MAN IS IT BAD. From the hostess to our waiter (with exception of the chef--they're typically wonderful!) it feels like everyone is in a rush and no one cares to help you even when placing a food order.   Two of my most recent trips resulting in forgetting to fill out drink/bar order. I can understand waiting on the bartender but water shouldn't take more than 10 minutes. Both of these outings were on Monday nights when the restaurant is at its slowest.   One waitress over charged us on fried rice, no big deal, but then argued that the three of us in our party ordered it while only one did. It took too long to resolve we almost wished we didn't speak up.  Last night our service was even worse, again waiting for the server to arrive, 10 minutes for water, forgetting one water and ignoring the table until our dinner was being cooked. Then it was each time we'd ask for something he would run away. No water refill, no soy sauce, going to the bar to get a container. I can understand on a Friday night but a slow Monday?   I hope this place improves because I really do enjoy it but for the price I'd prefer to spend my money elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rice didn&#39;t get delivered until well after dinner was made

-fn6ZXRV0XQXG0Nq0jhkWg.text: First time at Nakama tonight for my wife's birthday. Exceptional service & the staff were friendly. The food was really delicious too! The onions, steak, & shrimp were so tender! Punchline sent me here!

7gGniguCmTcK9vn9kq2c4g.text: Service was very good.  Food portions are exceedingly huge.  Very tasty.  Nice environment.  Restaurant had no issues with a group of 11.  I rate this 4-Arun's.

8c1otZRbpHnvrTVUlIwQ1w.text: Had a great dinner at Nakama. Sat at the tables and received great service from our waiter. Drinks were great and food came out quickly and well prepared. Large portion sizes which we enjoyed! Would definitely go back if I'm in Southside.

hnDx0pOD9KoJBFFg9K_7jQ.text: Thus Japanese restaurant used to have hour long waits. We went in on a Sunday afternoon expecting to have a wait but there was none. That was good! Then I understood why. The food was good but not great! It was decent but not delicious. The chef was nice but forgettable. The waiter was memorable though! Very upbeat and friendly personality. Also it was very dark in the dining room. Not a plus.

3EXHyqQ2DvZdz83wl6pQvw.text: We were there for lunch today and it was ok.  We probably won't go there again though.  The food was average.  The cleanliness was below average.  We ate at the hibachi table and even though there were 8 seats at the table, the hostess sat my hubby and I right up next to the only other couple at the table.  I assumed she was planning on filling up the whole table but once that didn't happen, I felt rude to move.  No big deal really.  They brought out water, soup, and salad and I heard the guy at our table say there was a hair sticking out of his water glass.  The cooktop had plenty of small pieces of food from the people before us but I figured the chef would clean it better before he cooked.  Well, he did wipe the very center but the old food remained.  I really tried to not watch after that.  The food was average.  We didn't have chopsticks at our table which was disappointing.  I'm sure they had them somewhere and I didn't ask so that's my own fault.  I just expect them to be on the table at Japanese restaurants.  Lunch prices were good.  Ill probably stick to my favorites though...Pho Van in the Strip and Mekong in Dormont.

bLckFWWRWZJqmzbMQ3MzLw.text: I love this place.  I have been to Pittsburg for business several times and I always make sure one night for dinner I stop in.  I have never ate on the hibachi side, but I LOVE there sushi.  The crowd is always lively and upbeat.  You will crave this place every time you set foot in Pittsburg.

1pCXR6-K9AH3-x2qEipr4A.text: We ordered three different sushis and found them all lackluster. I think the main problem was the rice--rubbery and not enough vinegar. The service was nothing to rave about, although the rolls did come out fast.  For the price, I would rather go elsewhere to get better sushi.

9BKKkATLkZSaQ6PmzSx1CA.text: I set up a reservation through open table for a Sunday evening. I specified that it was my sons birthday when I reserved. Arrived at Nakama and made sure the hostess knew it was my sons birthday. She asked if I wanted the pineapple or ice cream. I told her the ice cream. After eating a very mediocre dinner (saga is much better and a more reasonable price) we received our check. No ice cream and no recognition of my son's birthday. The chef even asked us if we had any birthdays and we told him yes! My husband chases after the waitress explaining that it was my sons birthday (4th time they were told). She arrives with the gong and no ice cream. Seriously don't even make an effort to celebrate a birthday if we have to beg for it. I will NEVER come back. The bathroom was absolutely disgusting. Soap dispenser ripped off the wall, paper products all over the floor, mildew around faucet and a bathroom attendant standing outside greeting you as you walk in a bathroom that is far worse than a convenience store. This place has had it's run and is done. Absolutely disgusting! And I have never given a review on here before. I can't help but to feel compelled to do so!

LCLnFWSqQDC2K8jtrZ-C3g.text: Went to this "sushi" restaurant last night and had hands down the worst sushi of my life.  Shrimp tempura was beer batter, not tempura.  Seaweed salad was hard - how does that even happen?  Sushi was mushy with overcooked rice and too much of it.  Also the habachi fried rice tasted like burnt soy sauce with a sprinkling of dirt.  The atmosphere left me feeling as if I forgot my too short skirt, spray tan and box of condoms.  The waitress was very sweet and had our entire meal comped.  We tipped her generously and ran for the door.

2EnDII78A4h1nyWVM4fY5Q.text: Nakama has OK sushi.   Nakama is noisy, the waiters take forever to serve you, and it's way overpriced. If you want authentic sushi go to CHAYA THE BEST SUSHI IN THE BURGH!

2R7WCDuF8uo7w1mm1Lbgsw.text: I love the food and love the feel. The only thing that left me a bit cold was the bartending staff. I have been there three times on business trips and each time they seemed to be indifferent at best, except when my bill came and I got a huge smile and a "Have a wonderful night." which was about as sincere as a campaign promise.

MMtBplIxG0Q-l8THoR8BXQ.text: Sushi is inconsistent. I've had bad sushi here several times. Habachi is very good, but on the pricier side

yXLNDMaib9Erf8S2G_c-cQ.text: sushi was excellent, especially for being in Pittsburgh (far from any coast). Had their "ceviche", and while it tasted nothing like cevishe the tuna was very fresh and the sauce was great. Also had a salmon and avacado roll that was simple but delicious. Only reason they don't get more stars is the music - absolutely terrible, and got louder and more techno-inspired throughout the evening. May think about carry out next time :)

t5SdArOPwkc_gj2UvEhJdA.text: I love sushi - and even though Nakama is always extremely busy and crowded, they have a great sushi menu.  I had the avocado and Philadelphia roll when I was last here, but one young chef was very sweet and gave my friend and me an entire roll for free.  You can't beat that!

wrZ4xrqQgkm3ihZoKV1uuw.text: Great location in Southside and good if you want to fulfill a Hibachi craving. However, not the greatest Hibachi, nor the most authentic either. It's also really loud in the restaurant.

Oydi8TAa2bQ4hHnV1YsDww.text: Not sure why the low reviews but this is one of my favorite Habachi places in Pittsburgh.  If everyone is mad about the wait for a seat, then reserve a table!!  The food is absolutely amazing, and the waiters are very nice as well.  This is a great place to grab dinner but don't forget lunch!  The food is quite pricey, a dinner plate at the grill can cost you a quick $25, and that's not including drinks and sushi.  Tab for two people including drinks is usually about $100, well worth it if you ask me.  Right after dinner you can find a great place to grab drinks in the South Side.  If you're complaining about the price, just don't go everyday!

aITkxvxQRIViDC6FP3CSgg.text: Love, love, love! We drive to Pitt every 4-6 weeks and my husband and I stop by whenever we can. I always get sushi, my favorite is the Nakama roll. My husband usually gets a full meal which he always enjoys. Drinks are always amazing as well. It's a little pricey for the area (I guess compared to DC is average), but well worth it!

DXCSIm1nntaN8WX5UJBBzQ.text: Anyone with a brain will instantly recognize that this place is not about the food AT ALL. It's about its function on the South Side; the Dream House for all the Ken and Barbie types. You will find Pittsburgh guido / yinzer OAFS eagerly paying through the hose for over-priced meat in hopes of wooing one of the many ex-sorority, Louis Vuitton bag hag bar WENCHES. For the poor OAFS who slobber over these WENCHES with their wallets, this watering hole is their surest spot to buy tuna. As for the WENCHES; it is the perfect place to parade the whitest teeth, highest heels, and blondest roots. This restaurant is the pole-dancing embodiment of what your average black and gold bleedin' yinzer believes to be upscale. Case in point, a hand-soap-offering attendant in the men's restroom; truly ridiculous........... just smacks of a naive pretentiousness that only the provincial mind-set of a South Side bar-barian would find 'classy'. I guess I'm not one for 'classy' restaurants anyway; they are always way too tacky.

Nx_makTop8bQUtwm34Xtng.text: I had the best experience at Nakama tonight. I am lactose intolerant and told the waitress, the amount of attention I got and the effort the staff went though to make my meal lactose free was amazing! The staff was so friendly, food was amazing and our waitress Jess was great! We also got to meet the owners an they are the nicest people. My friends and I come here once a month and always have a great experience! I recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys a friendly atmosphere and delicious food!

1yLbSUUXVFuqPai81vadgQ.text: I went to the hibachi with a few friends here on a weeknight, and I didn't try the sushi so I can't speak to it.  It was pretty packed and indeed, it was very loud and very dark.  You seriously might want to bring a flashlight to read the menu (I'm not joking).  There were only 4 of us at the hibachi table, so the  fun factor was pretty dulled down, but it didn't help that you couldn't really hear what the guy was trying to say anyway.  The server had a hard time hearing me as well, but my order of chicken was correct.  So as for the food: Salad - was well saturated with ginger dressing -I mean they must have tossed it with a good amount of dressing before bringing it out.  The dressing was good, but definitely not that good.  Soup - salted and fine, nothing notable. Shrimp flambe - chewy, tasteless, didn't even have the butter flavor. Rice - steamed and fine Chicken and veggies - dry dry dry chicken, veggies were good, and the flavors on the veggies were very good.   Sauces - okay The ladies room: Pretty clean, and also staffed.  Bottom line for me - I wouldn't come back here on my own volition - there are other places in Pgh I would try first.

IGT2sEP1rWygJ7pdlJabcA.text: fun restaurant, EXTREMELY rude people working there.  I would suggest confirming your reservation multiple times, at least 3.    ---BEGIN RANT---  I went here with a group of 10 people, we made the reservation a week in advance, and when we showed up on a Saturday night the place was PACKED, the wait for a table would be 2 hours, and our reservation was nowhere to be found.  Lost reservation was bad, but to top it off the hosts and hostess had MAJOR attitude insisting that we were lying about making a reservation, arguing with us for no reason, and generally making us feel very unwelcome.  Personally I don't enjoy being treated like crap when all I want to do is bring your restaurant lots of business.   Just because your restaraunt is decorated in a trendy way and serves sushi doesn't mean you aren't in Pittsburgh, so lose the NYC attitude Nakama!  ---END RANT---

KjYRYb53o4Kvb_DVm0vTRA.text: I personally never had the hibachi, I like to sit up at the bar. Its usually pretty hard to find a seat but if you are patient and come with only 1 other person, its usually doable.   The rolls are actually very fresh, and very delicious. I eat a lot of sushi and I would definetly say this is fresh fish. I would also add that the rolls are very creative... i have never had a roll that I am not satisfied with.  There is also a great atmosphere as usually it is loud, lots of people, TV's everywhere for watching the game. They also have pretty good service!   I definetly love coming to this place, if only it didn't take so long to find a seat!

YqfszDN9xqCHVEeiBCxNag.text: I worked at a top notch sushi restaurant and was educated very well with the real definition of sushi over summer. and having come back to pittsburgh and eating at nakama, i was sadly disappointed. no one knows what they're serving and it's just a trendy place that pretends to serve sushi for people to say they "eat sushi". the drinks and bar section is fun and the tvs are great for games. but i would not go back there for any food any time soon.

f1SLOSey32InIJy2KlbzXQ.text: Always busy. Good sushi...a little on the pricey end but its always a popular place to go.

vYZNCrn2yTdckkTO7xqcuw.text: I remember this place being awesome....not the case anymore. The restaurant felt dirty, the food mediocre and the prices way too high. Also, the employees all looked a mess with dirty pants, mis matched uniforms etc.  I am very surprised the owner/manager let this place fall so hard.

VlqvTuuOUiSCr0pYOSZPWA.text: This review is only for the sushi bar!  The first time I was here, the sushi tasted AMAZING! The Baked Alaska Roll was topped with salmon that had a smoky taste, which gave the roll an extra kick. I've came back twice to get the same roll, but it no longer had the smoky taste...perhaps it was by accident that the first time tasted so perfect!  I've also had the Boston Roll, Hanalei Roll, Pittsburgh Penguin Roll, and probably a couple more.. don't remember. They consistently have a good balance of ingredients and sauce.   Presentation was great. Last time, I had my rolls spread out on the plate in the shape of a giant flower hehe  Service was always fine, never have to wait too long for the dishes. I always come here if I'm in the area.. even if I've already had dinner, just to get a sushi roll to-go!

yepvBbDpIgdVh4xSzyWgjg.text: Nakama in Southside is great. Nakama Express in Greentree is not good. The staff there is disrespectful and lazy. I would not go back.

5ajRdZKkqOtHc3fBz0LQrw.text: This was my second experience there. That being said it was sub par in the service end of the establishment. Food... AMAZING..!!! "Show"... Eh... Hostess was completely and utterly rude to us and her co-workers.   The habachi segment left us wanting more of a show... Tables around us were laughing and having fun and our guy did nothing more than cook and cut vegetables..... Our server was decent. Young kid and full of energy and pretty attentive!   Great place to come but they need to retrain or get rid of the dead weight in the hostess stand and hype up the particular chef we had.

nqo1i9FKF3lRDKbUuA4A1w.text: My boyfriend and I walked in to have dinner, and requested to be sat at the sushi bar. The host pointed to where we could seat ourselves but then quickly shouted that she needed to take our Starbucks because she couldn't allow any outside drinks. We looked around puzzled because there was a dirty table beside us with an empty Starbucks cup. She refused to let us drink our coffees so we unfortunately left. Terrible customer service. She should have offered to pour our coffees into one of their own cups.

mEtpWyGppiZHoRQS3QGDFw.text: Few issues I've had here, typically get take out.  No plastic utensil,  got soup??? To bad.  Also they'll say 15 min and I'll get there in 15 to wait another 20 min.  Dissapointed

KpNYr58OjuMqdrwAz4HnUA.text: I ordered delivery through Uber eats.  My food arrived a mess, which is most likely not the restaurant's fault so I let that slide and will take that up with Uber.  However, I ordered hibachi meals, 3 of them.  I also ordered sushi as well.  I received no sauce with my order.  No soy sauce, shrimp sauce or steak sauce.  I called the restaurant, because this is their mistake and spoke with a manager named Sum or Sam, I couldn't make out her name due to the noise in the background.  I explained the issue and she told me to come and pick it up.  No apology or otherwise for the mistake.  I explained that I ordered delivery because I didn't have a means to pick it up at this time, and she said oh well.  At that point she said, well I'm not going to keep discussing the same thing and hung up on me.  I called back in and am currently waiting for an owner to contact me.  A simple I'm sorry goes a long way, further more don't offer delivery through a third party if you can't provide the items that are supposed to come with an order.  I won't be going to this establishment or ordering from them again.

AYSQK81SzEqP4ENHP3e44A.text: A few friends and I went to Nakama for dinner after spending the afternoon at Skybar nearby.  We all had on bathing suits WITH cover ups.  In particular, one of my friends and I were wearing almost identical outfits (sheer dresses over out bathing suits) except that she even had shorts on under her dress.  She is black and I am white.  The manager on duty approached her and asked her to leave because she was not "obeying the dress code" but he didn't say anything to me, in an arguably more revealing outfit.  When she asked him for clarification, he asked did she want to speak to the owner and she said yes, to which he replied, "well he's not here."  I can completely understand upholding a dress code, but I cannot comprehend selective dress codes.  If her outfit was unacceptable, then so was mine and we should have both been asked to leave but he ONLY said something to her!  He then proceeded to call the police and told them that my friend was "causing a scene" (she wasn't.)  I will never set foot in this racist establishment again!

VrxzYPeGU_67uB3Q0KjdEw.text: My second time to Nakama left a lasting impression enough for me to never return. I ordered the shrimp and chicken during the lunch hour and it wasn't good. I couldn't even finish it, and I didn't even get all of the side dishes. I was gonna take it home for the dogs, but they wouldn't have eaten it either. I had a friend pay for my meal, but I felt so bad she wasted her money on that shitty meal. Also, take a look at the cleanliness, or lack there of. A lot of work needs to be done or just shut it down altogether!!! Also, try an exterminator for your rat situation!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gross.
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. These vents!!! I can&#39;t believe we were breathing this shit in!

06fP8PPycO7j37NBJjYDtQ.text: I've been going to Nakama for years now. I have never thought the hibachi was anything special, especially since you're paying that much for it.   Now onto the sushi, while it isn't fantastic, it is on the better side for Pittsburgh. Definitely not my favorite, but it's consistent and good. Whenever I have a craving and don't want to get all dressed up for the night, Nakama is my go to.   Service is alright here, rarely is it quick, so make sure you have some time to spend. It is definitely pricey, for 4 rolls and 2 beers it was close to $80.

fBW0DionMW54JqR9-qXKnQ.text: The management is terrible!!!!! I ordered a seafood combination ( lobster scallops shrimp ) they give me tuna scallops and shrimp forget to bag my salad and soup!!!! On top of that the seafood combination cost 4-8$ more I called to address this the Chinese lady offered me a four dollar refund after they forgot my stuff an over charged me sad business practice I'm never going there again poor management

kFpMV809vAIwWK8jJ9BVUA.text: When you ass black ladies that they're not welcome because they have on a bathing suit and they are covered with dresses and or shorts and tops but the girls next to them can be with their boobs hanging out showing the Coots where is that the right thing to doask one group to leave who were swimming covered in their bathing dresses and shorts while people sitting in the restaurant got the slip down almost falling out shorts so short you can see their Hoochie what is going on here

3nALdYA86K3BmuB-EImhnA.text: I went here with my friends to celebrate joint birthdays and we all decided in checking out this place, because who doesn't love hibachi? Right?!  Anyway we had made reservations for about 15 people and were seated at a hibachi table. Everybody made their drink orders and were given our drinks in a reasonable amount of time.   Hubby and I went for the hibachi, while the majority of our party opted for sushi. Anyway, one of the things that I expect from a hibachi joint is a cheesy, interactive chef and this guy was none of those things. He just basically cooked his dishes and did one onion volcano and that's about it. No crowd interaction or goofy jokes..... this is something I always expect.  Also there were no acknowledgement of anyone's birthday despite telling the waitress.  People that ordered got their fried rice, but I ended up ordering steamed rice, which never arrived when my scallops and steak and veggies had arrived. I was starving at this point so I just proceeded eating and noticed that the waitress did not come back to the table, even to refill drinks. I actually had to flag her down to inquire about my rice. My husband has finished his beer and actually wanted another one but was nowhere to be found. The service was pretty disappointing overall. Another thing that I found disappointing was the small portion size for hibachi. Usually I am used to walking out with left overs for two days from one order of hibachi. The sides were just a small portion of rice, vegetables, and soup and salad, but no lo mein or other hibachi standards.  Not even a small scoop of ice cream at the end.  So needless to say I was kinda bummed out about this too.   In terms of the food I will have to say that my scallops were perfectly cooked, and my steak was pretty awesome, but overall I found the customer service here pretty lacking.  At one point my husband was walking to the bathroom and was nearly run over by a member of the wait staff and didn't even receive an "excuse me".  The lack of service kind of overshadows everything else.   I also think that their decor was pretty cool and really liked their vibe, but overall my experience was just meh.

PE7Yd71gPdHsQav48uJrVg.text: Seated our large group within minutes even though we didn't have a reservation, food was hot and delicious, they actually had vegan choices for their specialty rolls! Hibachi chef was a gentleman and did a good performance and was a great cook. Service was fast and polite. The magic tricks in the lobby while we waited was a plus :) Would recommend!

eHISlTg0zYfGYlhYKHTQ9A.text: Nakama: Overall, I give three stars due to okay food and varying levels of service.  Service: I came here for my friend's birthday. We had a pretty large party and made reservations ahead of time. When we got there, we ended up still waiting for another thirty minutes or so, which was fine with us. What got us a little annoyed was how the hostess was not kind to us or anyone else that was there at the time. When we were getting seated, they were unsure where to seat us and we had to walk around the restaurant once before settling.  Our waitress was one of the sweetest people ever. Her name was Stephanie and I want to say how much I appreciated having her as our waitress. The whole restaurant is loud and super crowded, and she remained calm and helpful throughout the entire night. I would often see her running from place to place.  The manager was also very sweet. My girlfriend made an ice cream cake for our friend and he was the one who brought it out for us, helped us cut it, and even washed the cake pan afterwards. He is obviously very proactive in customer satisfaction. In addition, the restaurant didn't charge us extra for all of this, which many restaurants do.  Food: Food was only okay for me. I got the chicken diabolo and my girlfriend got the steak. The chicken was not fresh, extremely dry, and chewy. The steak was not the greatest either, it seemed to have the same problems of being a little dry and chewy, not as bad as my chicken was though. I was definitely very full after all of this though, it was a lot of food. If I ever come back, most likely, I will get the shrimp, since that was pretty good.  This was my first Hibachi restaurant experience. While I understand the excitement of the show, etc., I don't think it's worth it for the quality of the food.

MgUCsmZ1nvDuoE7-gZrKww.text: All I had here was sushi which I found to be okay. Between the two of us, we got the Boston Roll and the Rainbow Roll. Rainbow roll was really good, except one of the pieces of fish tasted a bit slimy to me, so that was a little unsettling. Rest of the roll was great, however. The Boston roll though was very underwhelming. It was supposed to have cream cheese in it, but for the life of us, we could not taste the cream cheese! How are you going to advertise cream cheese as one of your key ingredients when there's basically no cream cheese except for maybe in one measly piece? Quite disappointing.  Service was good. Our waitress was nice, quick, and efficient. Just how servers should be. A little on pricier side though, so watch for that.  Bottom line: sushi-wise, this place is okay. I won't be craving it, but if someone were to invite me out to dinner there, I wouldn't put up a fuss. It's not a place I would go out of my way to eat at.

PWQ6X1gaC_Z-zBnQE80XYg.text: We had a wonderful dinner here!  The vibe was fantastic, great music and a happy staff. Everyone was smiley and friendly and seemed happy to be there. The sushi was good, but if I'm being honest it was rolled a little loose. But tasty!  The price point was pretty typical, and I liked all the windows. Would definitely go again!

KtvXz96bKK2zTDr00Cb0DA.text: Well... this place has lost it's luster for me. Everything that used to taste high quality and fresh tastes just okay now. The sushi isn't that great anymore. The habachi just isn't the same.  What happened? Did I change? Did this place change? I think it's a little of both. Maybe I can compare it to a relationship. Yes, that's it. Things were awesome at first. We were in love and everything was just perfect. The sushi was fantastic and fresh. The habachi was so delicious I wanted to lick my plate.  Then over time things started to deteriorate. The sushi didn't taste like my beloved Penn Ave Fish, my new amore. The habachi was missing something. Did the soup recipe change? Not as much flavor. Did the portions get smaller. Where did my sprouts go?! Things started to head south...  The last straw was the whole atmosphere or Club Nakama we'll call it. The music is pulsating techno. The crowd is judge-y. The service is lacking. And the food, it's nothing special. Sad, because what once was, is no more:(  It's time to break-up. We had a good run. We may run into each other once in a while and be friendly, but for now, it's time we take a break. Might be for good this time. You never know....

8WyLBlUXIQcN8TMxtI9ekw.text: We hit up nakama in the southside for my birthday.  Went on a friday night, the crowd wasnt too bad.  Nakama is a place ive been by a bunch of times and always wanted to give it a try.    For the money, what it was, and coming from Westmoreland county it was really not worth it for me.  The habachi was decent but no different than the places in monroeville or greensburg.  We also had sushi was was decent but nothing fantastic.

yHjQH9AL5waaRiJzLmGYrA.text: Once we got seated the chef came out after an hour wait. They charge extra for fried rice, and they didn't give you an option of noodles. You had to choose between shrimp or mushrooms. Usually those are both given to you free of charge. Other than that the food was pretty good.

_6nJhfe6Pl6qBhMFaqYh4g.text: I've been to Nakama several times over the years and in my opinion it's just okay. I never loved it but it was always pretty good. I recently went on a Friday night with a group of 6 and sat at a hibachi table. The waiter was nice and the service was decent. It wasn't fast but also not extremely slow. For an appetizer, we got sushi. My boyfriend liked his nigiri. I on the other hand was not too satisfied with my philly roll. It was just okay. The avocado was hard...not the freshest sushi I've had. As for my meal I ordered the hibachi shrimp. I forgot how huge the portions were! Seriously so much food...soup, salad, rice, veggies and shrimp. It was all good but didn't blow me away. The hibachi chef wasn't impressive and didn't really put on a show. Nakama is a south side staple and has been around for years but honestly the hype has died down for me. I was surprised by how busy it was so I guess people still enjoy it.

Sb1HwER0okw6aKzRrW9jnw.text: This visit was like the final straw of an ex boyfriend that I hadn't gotten over....except now I am!  Nakama just isn't the same restaurant I remember. Maybe it's been a few years since I've been to Nakama, but instead of being a sushi/hibachi hot spot it feels more like a bar in south side that just happens to have sushi.  The staff seemed disinterested and chided us for making a reservation. Apparently we only needed one if we were ordering hibachi (we weren't).  The sushi fit our craving, but it was just mediocre. The seaweed salad was unusually sweet and the sushi was at least room temperature. I usually enjoy sushi that is a little on the colder side.  All in all, I'm glad we went to check it out since my romanticized last visit, but am ready to move on!

BEg-5AeC6elLGkrMivpJbg.text: This is a great place for good drinks. Has a great vibe as well! We got there around 6 on a Friday evening, didn't have to wait at all since we sat at the bar. Bartender came over almost immediately and was very attentive all evening. The other bartenders were helpful as well, which made for great service. I had coconut shrimp, which was delicious, as well as a Hawaiian roll--which I wasn't the biggest fan of. But overall the whole experience was good. I'd recommend!

mDIYdpbK3aSSs4Y2CnF_kw.text: I had been to Nakama several times before this visit and the service was very good. I am never a person to play the race card or scream someone is racist. However, on this night I must honestly say I felt like I was back in the slave days. On Saturday February 9th I visited Nakama with a young lady. We walked into the restaurant and sat at a pair of seats close to the entrance. After about 10 minutes I asked the hostess was there a server working in our area. The hostess who was great by the way, said he will be around soon. Another 10 minutes passed and no menu, no water, and no greeting. I asked the server could we at least get a menu and she kindly obliged a d also gave us our water. The hostess then said that's your server right there. I asked him could I speak to him and he blatantly said NO! I tried to speak to him and second time and the server walked away. During this time a white couple walks in and the server immediately greets them with menus and goes to get there water. Immediately a white male sits beside us and again the server goes and retrieves a menu and water. I asked to speak to the manager but was directed to the owner. I voice my concerns to the owner and he shakes his head and says I'll give you free drinks. I didnt come to Nakama for drinks!!!! The owner directed another male server to wait on my friend and I. Since when does a server have the option not to wait on two guests? The server that took over was GREAT!! However, my night was ruined and no one seemed to care. During this entire fiasco the initial server that did not speak to us kept right on visiting the people beside us. I could here him say if you need anything I'm your guy. I was pissed off but felt helpless at the time. Finally the manager comes over and offers a discount.  I have to say this restaurant will never see another dollar if mine. Basically this server had an issue with the color of my skin.  I have to ask is this the type of behavior Nakama allows???

hPucwJrw9gyjk_N19-_gcw.text: Terrible! Ordered shrimp fried rice for 12$ and the portion was like a teacup. Won't be going back there again.

WA9nlA8angxNK-XZvWo39Q.text: I'm not really sure what the hype has been about here.  Sushi was good but average. It wasn't plated pretty either which may have helped my opinion (haha). We ate at the sushi bar. Hibachi dining room was empty. This may be a good place for drinks and apps but I will go elsewhere for sushi and hibachi. Overpriced in my opinion. Good, but small portions for sushi and pricey.

30jOxcA86TfFYSbhU9-0tw.text: I love Hibachi and Nakama is by far one of the highest quality Hibachis I have ever experienced. I usually get the Hibachi steak. It is cooked to perfection and the shrimp appetizer and yum yum sauce is to die for! They're mixed drinks are fantastic especially the Parasol Girl. Our Chef was very fun and entertaining. They really brought you into the show. Be sure to sign up for their dining card so you can get a meal for free!

KlduMNrUZrmwrKCO1j7KDA.text: This place literally never gets old. I've lived in Pittsburgh my whole life and while others may go to newer more 'trendy' sushi places in the city, this one is the BEST and always gets it RIGHT.. every time. Very quick service when seated at the bar. Even on a friday or saturday night! The bartender we usually have, Wesley is always pleasant, quick & friendly.. He even makes me a drink that is no longer on the menu! Excellent service from him. The ambiance is great, and the music is the best! Very upbeat

f_X-931t3sUWqsXqT56NnA.text: I used to go to Nakama all the time, but I slowly steered away from it due to many other new sushi and hibachi options in the area & no longer living as close as I used to. I went to Nakama for the first time this past Friday in 2-3 years. This place has sadly declined. It is definitely not as good as it used to be & the hibachi just isn't the same. Had the management changed over the past few years? A group of 6 of us went for Hibachi before a night out. The service was good, but a little slow. The hibachi chief was not very impressive & my tuna steak was flavorless. Additionally, the vegetables served with our hibachi were still hard when they placed on our plates. The portions were huge, but nothing great. I will say the cherry blossom roll that we had as an appetizer was really good, but pricy. I am surprised Nakama is always busy still. I'm sure I'll be back, but probably not for a while.

VgyD1uc3sfd30aW2h5kxyQ.text: This sushi made me really sad and sushi is my favorite food. I've had bad sushi, but this is by far the worst sushi I've ever had. The rice was mushy and blocked all together when there should be some separation and it should be gently packed. It was just really bad rice. The fish was cut horribly and tasted really fishy, which is not how sushi should be. In fact, I couldn't even eat some of the fish because it tasted so bad. I understand Pittsburgh is landlocked but this is truly something else. The skill and care involved in making this sushi was absent. This ruined my day. My stomach hurts. This was disgusting and I'd highly advise to never come here.  Update: I had to run to the bathroom to throw up, my stomach still hurts and I still have that awful fishy taste in my mouth. This has been traumatic.

tX4wx4i5l0cEFP5iaLpRmg.text: Nakama is a go-to Hibachi spot. While not overly pricey, the portions are ample to leave you satisfied without denting your wallet too much.  If you're hankering for good Hibachi food, definitely stop by Nakama. I've been here many times, and they consistently deliver a good meal with a good atmosphere and friendly staff to boot.

msFj8puFAIL1g00uxGa5Iw.text: Lunch time is the best value and bang for your buck if you want Hibachi, and you definitely want Hibachi. It's rarely crowded at lunch and the portions are generous so I always have leftovers. At hibachi lunch, you get your entree, soup or salad (go with a friend, each get one, and share!), mushroom or shrimp appetizer, and fried rice. It's a great deal and always ask for more of the shrimp sauce. The chefs are fun, service is good, sushi is great. My favorite entrees are the chicken, strip steak, and scallops. All are tasty options.   Dinner is much pricier plus you have to pay extra for the fried rice and you get a lot of extra sides like the soup and salad and a vegetable medley. Personally, I think lunch prices are a better deal.

F5p0kNZn-j71JyCWGaxu9w.text: Read previous reviews and people seems like love or hate this place. But we still decide to give it a try just because of it is located in the heart of southside and it would against logic that it serves the worst sushi. It was a Sunday night and we were able to grab a seat very quickly. We ordered seaweed salad, tuna poke, Unami sashimi, rainbow roll and Hawaii style roll. I have to say I am glad we gave this place a chance. The seaweed salad could be better but it certainly didn't taste bad tho. Just compare to everything else it was just average. But of course Everything else tasted great! The reason I am giving it a four star not five are service and sanitary.   Service, the waitress refilled my water once and then just didn't think I might need another refill. Drank the last drop of my water, not happy with this. Sanitary, saw a huge fly on the window(thank god not on our table or even food). I'm guessing it might just got in since the door was open and we sat at the high table area which is kind close to the door.  So over all, some miner change will put this place to a five star sushi place.

U0svxEY95HnfmZIQJucoKw.text: That Baked Alaskan roll though....what it does to my mouth, mmmmm  Nakama is smack dab in the middle of the action known as Carson Street. It's a good spot for dinner before going out or to celebrate something special, unless you're looking for someplace quiet.  The drinks here are delish and while the habichi is ok, the sushi is AMAZING. If habachi isn't your thing, you can opt for a table or sit at the bar. The servers and bartenders are very friendly adding to the overall experience.   Valet parking is offered on the weekends.  Finding a spot to park along the street during the week on the evenings is fairly easy.   Dine solo or with friends and Nakama has all the makings for a good time.

He did put a fire in the top of his hat, which really just made me more anxious than entertained. I'll probably go to another hibachi restaurant next time since food is comparable, staff is more fun, and prices are lower.  I wouldn't say this restaurant left me disappointed, but I also wouldn't say I walk away satisfied.

We sat near the Carson street side windows (great for people watching).   Our server was very friendly and had suggestions for us when we asked. He was quick and didn't miss a thing on our order. I noticed the busser was working extremely hard as well! Every-time we finished a dish they were walking by to grab it which was nice.   Sushi was good. They could improve on the quality and portions but overall pretty good. Make your own opinions but I would take the bad reviews with a grain of salt. I find most people usually only review when upset... food for thought. I had a good experience and will be back.

We also ordered a bowl of chicken fried rice that my husband claimed was the best he had ever had ( I think they cooked it with a LOT of butter). We watched the sushi chefs prepare way more interesting looking dishes while we waited for our food and enjoyed the atmosphere. Our waitress, Lauren, was a giant bag. That is my only complaint.  Not sure if we were just really luck to get the 3 seats as we walked in or what??  There was a constant line up in the waiting area so maybe we were lucky.

JU2Ht1rYabkfnsTb0c9DPQ.text: I can't actually comment on the food.  The place looked nice relative to a lot of neighboring establishments and was recommended by our lunch-time server @ Nola (very good Creole) and our concierge.  My low rating comes from the fact that I called twice to make a reservation and no one answered.  After taking a cab from downtown we learned there was a private party and we wouldn't be able to take in the Jersey Shore fist pumping scene (thanks Callan W for the visual).  Simply disappointed in the lack of basic customer service.  We ended up down the street at the Pittsburgh Steak Company.  Not sushi but the gorgonzola filet melts in your mouth!!

TEKOi_7Bq5-vy0T9nh1TYw.text: I like the Hibachi experience, and I don't eat seafood. That being said, it is a little overpriced for the quality of the food. I have gone a few times. I like that they give veteran's a meal for free on veteran's day.

GhAkMDngBgNPuiyb1AKAzQ.text: Very busy at lunch.  Almost like they weren't ready for a Friday lunch.  Slow service, mediocre food.  I think I will skip this place the next time I am in town...

hKJlmuVzPJspAhrCpU3WPQ.text: I've had pretty good sushi in the NY / NJ area and this would definitely be a place we'd go on the regular, so for the people of Pittsburgh PA, you guys deff have good sushi in town. Not only was the sushi good, but a great selection of beers, and a cool sports bar feel. Really hip, not something I expected in Pitt, very NYC like.   My one comment would be on a Sunday during Football Season, nobody want's to see pirate baseball on tv, especially regular season baseball.

O33RFYcxIk8sWHqU7u6HoQ.text: The hanalei roll is my favorite sushi roll anywhere ever. Sushi is always fresh. Hibachi  is average. I don't get why people like the atmosphere. I like going here only when it's not very busy.

R9q01LqHOLmCB_FSZeW9Lw.text: Over priced food with a side of misogyny. No thank you!

uXLPxZ3b-mCqA9cBH0T5ug.text: So it was payday and I decided to treat myself to some overpriced cocktails and sushi.  My wallet was bleeding a little bit after this night but it was worth it because you can observe cougars (literally in animal prints) hunt their prey. Dinner and a show!    OOO and not to mention there was a magician! YES, a magician at Nakama.  Hilarious. As far as magicians go, I guess he was good! It still kills me that Nakama and Max & Ermas have the same entertainment.   Service was a bit spotty. The place was packed but we still stay at the bar for 20 minutes sans cocktails.   Pro: Busy, Lively, good cocktail list, fresh sushi, good place to start the night  Cons: Slow service, pricey, strange amount of bachelorette parties (they has sashes and crowns)   Every once in awhile this place can be fun!

VznKMiTOaOecmmQhPGf8Qw.text: Total bad experience..Rude waitress + average food. Sharing food is a strict no. Walked out of there as soon as possible.

Y1IDFr1BfCRwsLuy65NH-g.text: I love to eat here during the day, but never on crowded nights or weekends when you don't get any service. The stars are for the sushi chefs of course and their attention to their customers. The waiters still suck.
