VtdFmrt-t2TcjANDXEzm2g.text: Great atmosphere and good bar/wine selection.  Sushi was great. Very yuppie and young professionals crowd.  My only complaint comes from the service.  We were seated at a hibachi table and then told unless the majority of us were getting hibachi we would have to sit at the sushi bar. I wouldn't have had a problem with this but the place was not that crowded and my party of 4 ended up spending a lot of money on sushi and drinks so its difficult for me to understand how they wouldn't accommodate us at a table.  Additionally, they forgot my appetizer and made no effort to apologize at the end of the night.  Great atmosphere, food and location. Improve your service.

r1KBZZ4k2zGmGXiwCHv1vA.text: Aside from the Southside ambiance and the bar, there is nothing more here to see than an overtly OVER-priced,  UNDER-quality Japanese fair.  Sushi "chef"s were laughable (being taught as they made my dishes... really? for a 30$ dish???), service was slow, having to remind the waitress over and over for even a glass of water... and the quality of the dishes mediocre.  Unless you are offering to spend at least double the amount worthy of the actual value of food and service, I would highly discourage anyone from visiting this establishment.  If you are looking for a classy, Japanese restaurant with a bar, I would go to UMI - SOBA on Ellesworth St. in Shadyside.

TWycCvKbgP4nCh8CbleTFQ.text: I love Nakama- have been going there every now and then for years. Sushi is great, hibachi is good as well. However, last night I decided to order a healthier version of my meal. I asked they could cook it without butter and with double vegetables, no rice.  (a simple request that most Hibachi restaurants are OK with). A few minutes after I ordered, the manager came out to ask me if I was allergic to butter- I said no just watching what I eat. He told me that if they busier, they would not be able to make my requested meal but if they were busy, they would not be able to make it. He wanted to make sure I knew in case I wanted to order again. While he was very nice about it, I found it troublesome that a restaurant that cooks everything fresh will not customize a meal while busy. Not a huge deal overall, but still would not come here if you are trying to be health-cautious.

nmwYNlbDGbKRuYHtkEee5w.text: If you want Benihana's in Pittsburgh, I guess this is the place to go. Other than the fact that they have some marketing and advertising genius who's greased the palms of every "guide to the city" and "best restaurants" free pamphlet that they hand out at hotel concierge desks, I don't know what all the hype's about.   They have a big sushi bar area, and quite a few grills in the back. We sat at a table with some PITT football players and I ordered the filet, while TY got surf and turf. It was all kind of eh, but I have to say that customer service was very good and all the staff were really nice. The filet was tender, but I think just the flavor of everything was mediocre, especially at their prices. We had a coupon for $15 in one of the aforementioned guide books, so pick one of those up before you spend your money here.

dGW3FXSQzJ8dfRc4aofpYA.text: The Sushi is really good! The Hibachi is also very flavorful, staff is friendly. The only downside of this restaurant is that it is super packed on weekends (just like all of the other popular restaurants). The spicy chicken egg rolls are really soooo good! Also, my family members that hate sushi actually really liked all of the tempura rolls.

S7PF31d4e3VZUYXgBMbCag.text: Used to be a staple on Carson but has really disappointed over the last few years. Still a pretty good meal but the service and flair are completely gone. The hibachi used to be so entertaining but now it's basically just watching someone awkwardly cook for you. Sushi is tasty but no options that really stand out. Table service is usually not great and the bartenders seem to use their phones more than mixing tins. Still a place I will go every now and again but there are many better options for this type of fare around the city.

3gZyEqRUKRXD9Vwzo7yiaw.text: Ugh this place is so overrated! It's cool that they cook in front of you and everything but the quality of the food is not great!!! I've been here twice for friends birthday dinners and I don't know why they like it here so much. The service is awful and everything is so overpriced!!! If I never go here again I would be fine with it but I bet one of my girlfriends will drag me here again

fMhGhe86DXaDFyq1j64U2Q.text: I recently went to Nakama for the first time for a first date - many firsts that night. Starting with the bad: We made dinner reservation for 7:15 and were a few minutes late. We were told that we lost our spot and had the choices to either wait a half hour to 45 minutes, sit at the sushi bar, or just order food at a table without the hibachi experience. We opted to get a drink at the bar  and wait it out. This was a Wednesday evening and the place was packed. No seats available at first so we checked out the drink menu and finally we got a couple of chairs.   The drinks were decent - I'm a lightweight so they were good for me. It worked out that we waited for the hibachi because we were able to be squeezed in within ten minutes.    I got Hibachi Seasame Chicken and my date got Nakama Tuna Steak. He also ordered sushi but our waiter had forgotten to bring it- It was really no problem because the portion sizes are pretty big and we probably couldn't have ate the sushi anyways.   I have no complaints about my chicken - It definitely exceeded my expectations based on the other reviews I have seen for it. My date goes there on the regular and so his Tuna Steak obviously has his coming back for more. The Onion Soup was by far one of the better Japanese soups I have had. It has a kick to it that I haven't tasted anywhere else.   Our hibachi chef was wonderful. He was entertaining, easy to talk to and was really good at his job. He even let us all try a little fried rice.   I always have had reservations about Nakama because I thought it was an overexposed restaurant that jacked its prices up because of its trendy reputation. I really enjoyed my time there. It was clean and had a lot of energy. I'll be back again.

1R7wrYVDppptne9NIPxwGg.text: Avoid the hibachi and save yourself from the rest of the night on the toliet!   Had the hibachi sesame chicken, my husband had the hibachi steak. First course onion soup was super salty, tasted like it was hot water with beef ramen seasoning. Salad was decent enough. Veggies served first then meat. Bland- nothing special. Certainly not worth $50. They also serve this nasty "shrimp sauce" which is basically thousand island dressing. I was worried about the food safety on the hibachi "chef's" cart. Kinda grimey-lookin.  Worst part was that later that night, both of us got sick from eating there. I'm talking sick like from the movie Bridesmaids.  It was bad. Spend your money elsewhere.

HUnxpkrSudDkcFu7puLUEQ.text: I wanted some good sushi on a Friday night, and didn't get it. Hibachi was good. And the ceramic cup was exciting

npw-jP8tOp9UeRizJUgNNw.text: A group of four of us went to dinner before a show in the south side. We alerted our server to our time window and she said no problem. Our servers attentiveness was minimal and we didn't require a lot. Our meals were okay but nothing special. When the bills came our prices were different than on the menu and when we asked our server about it she told us that we each had a $3.50 up charge for ordering fried rice rather than the white rice the meals came with. Our server never mentioned the up charge and she asked us which type of rice we would prefer! She was very rude about it in the end and never apologized or anything. We will spend our money elsewhere when we go to the next show.

9JIJJA7ghKHn1EFnG-SMYw.text: A wonderful sushi joint, which hosts the best appetizer ever (the tuna and avocado).   If you're looking for a one of a kind sushi experience definitely visit.

LrFWe-ggeuLhm2jvdUIyMA.text: Great atmosphere and great sushi! I wanted to take my friend from out of town down south side and be on the classier side of things. We strolled around and decided on nakama. We love sushi and wanted a good cocktail! How could we go wrong here? We sat at the sushi bar and were waited on quickly. Our waitress was great and attentive but not annoying. She was considerate and asked us if we wanted separate checks which I always forget to ask upfront. My friend got the nakama Cosmo which she thought had too much sour mix. I had the French kiss, it was great. Sweet and sour but not overly sweet. We then split three sushi rolls and seaweed salad. Love seaweed salad. Sweet and vinegary with a good crunch. We got the basic salmon roll, Hawaiian roll and haiku roll. They were so delicious and very fresh. Came quickly too on a very busy Saturday night. Great place to get hibachi with a group of friends or intimate for a date! Not the cheapest option for good sushi is south side but the atmosphere makes it very worthwhile!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi!
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nakama Cosmo on left. French kiss on right. Delicious!!

jErWDZZdxG0gOZEX9jDfAA.text: When they first opened the food was great. We would go at least once a month. In the last year or two the quality has gone down. The portions have gone down and the $$ has gone up. Also the consistency in the food has dropped.  Used to be our favorite place, now it doesn't come up when we talk about going to eat.

FdLSYjONVAPf686MAiSBBA.text: Went here with my BFF for her birthday. Cocktails were great, just a little heavy on the sour mix.  I got the house Cosmo and my friend had the French Kiss cocktail.  The French Kiss was tastier than mine.  I loved the atmosphere: dim lighting, a swanky bar and hibachi tables in the back.  Self seating around the bar so we didn't have to wait at all at 9pm on a Saturday night. Rolls are big and are a decent price and the fish is super fresh. Two of the rolls tasted exactly the same which was a little disappointing: the Hawaii roll and the Haiku roll. If you want more variety don't order them together. Overall, Would recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Z39wmGDkLX8KEVwAPafFWA.text: This is one of the most overrated restaurants I've been to in the south side! The prices are insane for what you get and I'm not even sure they actually know how to make sushi. Inari is one of my favorites, and when I ordered it here, all I got was 4 fried tofu skin sheets and a couple slices of cucumber. That is not inari sushi! I don't know what it was! Also, the bartenders have no idea how to make simple drinks. Don't bother ordering one unless you want it to be wrong, four times what it should cost, and 25 minutes after you order it.

T7xY8rLu43fEdcj2iQ_OsQ.text: This restaurant is AMAZING! My boyfriend and I  went there for dinner & were delighted  by the menu selection the ambiance at first but once our meal came, it was absolutely mind blowing. The sushi was so fresh, so delectible, so DELISH and I think this will be my new "go-to" spot in Pittsburgh for amazing sushi. There are so many more rolls that I would like to try. I cannot wait to return to Pittsburgh to go to Nakama again! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mouth watering....
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster/ crab fritter...yummy

2gr39T9VdlkA1vkMFhzAlQ.text: at Nakama Express in Greentree.  Horrible Service, it was wrong, and no one will correct the issue.  Don't even waste your time with the worthlessness that is this whole restaurant.  Part or the Corner Market & Ale in Greentree, I am so disappointed!

J-dLHdEm9RQa0ROUSa-eKA.text: My girlfriend and I decided to go to Nakama yesterday for some hibachi lunch. I have been here many times before, but this is the first I will write about it. We were seated immediately at one of the tables. There was a group of 5 already seated at the table we were seated at with their drinks already in hand and ready to order. We felt a bit rushed because they were ready to order and we just sat down. My girlfriend ordered the Spicy California Roll as an app. She said it was "ok".... Nothing special. ... But in their defense she also said it's a pretty plain roll. I got the Bobs Triple Combination with steak, shrimp, and chicken, while she got the Hibachi Shrimp. After she was eating the roll, the server came over and said "so, is the roll repulsive?!". To which my girlfriend responded "yeah, it's disgusting". It was just completely awkward. He didn't know if she was serious.. I did, and gave him the ok nod. It was just weird. I had some captain and cokes, she had a few Rieslings... The cook was great, the food was tasty as always. I do think he put a but too much salt in it, but it was still great. Our tab after tip was $121.00   All in all, an ok experience. If it wasn't for the awkward comment from the waiter, it would have been a 4 star.. I do love me Hibachi and it's the closest place to me, so I am sure I will be back. I do prefer Sapporo out on 60 because it is a family run business and you are always treated greatly...

GEAiwEBCaXUxVul8bADDnA.text: The manager, Sun, was awful. She had no customer service or hospitality skills at all. She served me the wrong sushi roll and told me I was wrong (um, hello the customer is always right) and she was giving our amazing waitress, Ashley, a hard time and arguing with her about the WRONG sushi roll. Ashley and Ryan, the servers, had amazing personalities and showed my table amazing hospitality. Besides the good sushi rolls (when I finally got the one I ordered) I would not recommend coming here at all. We also waited an hour for our table when we had a reservation.

XyOw8FI7g4JhNnsHxVgYTg.text: Over rated.  In most cases you get what you pay for except here, you pay more for average at best sushi.  The waitress had a terrible attitude and a face to match.  Yokoso is shitting on this place.  Not to mention have fun trying to find a decent parking spot on the southside.

9PHdPhkuVLa8EOwsle9T0w.text: Excellent food, excellent service. The Signature long rolls were delicious and the Nigiri cut was thick and satisfying.  The service was prompt and accurate, despite some complicated orders.   Highly recommended

YLizoyEW_EUnKNR4jizIZg.text: Have been here a few times when in town for work.  The place is a bit of meat market at times, but very entertaining.  It reminds me a lot of Ra Sushi.  I have only had the sushi and rolls, but the portions are enormous.  The quality is decent as well.  Drinks are okay, but I would skip any of the specialty cocktails.  Go with the sake bombs (sapporo and saki).  Late night is fun, as this is a place to be seen.

5zvIJjs_deBlztrvBTLEVA.text: Nikki was our waitress.  She worked so hard all night, not only for us, but for everyone in our section. Did a wonderful job for us considering we needed a new drink every five minutes!  She consistently asks if everyone is happy, which makes the dinner so much easier to enjoy.  Our chef was wonderful and cooked everything to perfection, along with asking the specifics when it came to little things we enjoyed about the meal.  Our valet service was also very personable and they made sure to open the door both times for my girl.  Really appreciate that.    I'll be coming here for years more.

AR1MG_lFrEIY8kCzEYc9NQ.text: Let me start with what works at Nakama: The servers. They're super nice and efficient.  What doesn't work is the food, the prices, the crowds, the incredibly busy, loud bar without the possibility of being seated in the quieter room (reserved only for Habachi eaters) -- even when you're paying $15.00/person FOR LUNCH!  And, the restaurant demands that you dress in nice casual wear. No t-shirts, yet the food was terrible!  We shared the Spider Roll and the Chicken and Shrimp Habachi plate, as well as a seaweed salad. The salad was okay. The Spider Roll came in a sticky, overly-sweet sauce which ruined the flavor. The crab was rubbery and seemed old. The chicken Habachi was waaaaaaay overcooked (dry to the point of being hard to swallow),  the shrimp smelled old , and it was NOT DEVEINED (read: it still had the poop tunnel in it!). ICK! This is supposed to be Pittsburgh's finest sushi restaurant? Old fish meets overcooked chicken, meets truly bad sushi, meets loud bar with no option to sit elsewhere (even when you're not drinking), meets overpriced lunch menu!  My advice: Go elsewhere! If you want something to eat, check out ANY other restaurant in the South Side. Even if it's bad, it won't be as expensive as Nakama. But, there are better places to be had in Pittsburgh. Not being from the area, I can't speak for sushi bars, but,  I especially like The Gypsy Cafe and Primanti's in the South Side. Cheers!

AO-tBj-tRjKDj1gGtAQzFw.text: Went out with a group of friends, had a great time.....food was good, a little too salty for my taste but no real complaints. I will say, after having hibachi many times....the meat was NOT overlooked!!!! Had the Butcher's choice, strip and chicken were proper temps, tender and juicy....Miso soup was tasty, salad over dressed....my appetizer was the lettuce wraps, way too salty. Would go back but definately not a 1st choice in the 'burgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Lettuce wraps, salad and Mangotini

kNf4F94tVy4s4Lberr7Hvg.text: Wow!!!! How pretentious this mediocre little restaurant is!   A dress code in the southside you say!  That's funny!   Your food isn't good enough for you to be so choosy, henny!!!!  Your fish isn't the freshest in the burgh, and your little southside bar/ restaurant is not FANCY!  You are not Monterey Bay!! Or Le Mont!!! Or even Ruth's Chris! You are a 3 star restaurant in a bar section of a sports town!!!!!'  I've literally been at lunch when crackheads walked into your bar harassing customers!   So slow your role!   It's summer time. Some women wear midriff shirts.  It's not your freakin place to tell women how to dress!  **Update!  I should actually be thanking you!  You're rude policy dictating a woman's choice in attire drove us into the arms of your MUCH MUCH better competitor!   SOCIAL HOUSE in downtown is not far away, has better food,a friendlier staff, comparable prices, and aren't criticizing their clientele based on outdated patriarchal views.

KSA7CFE43IPVy61HReqm6g.text: Took family to Nakama last night and we all absolutely loved it!  The food was delicious and our chef was great!  I don't have a single negative thing to say about Nakama.

H-XQLYMh4JV6LkhZM23oFg.text: There is not one Japanese person in this establishment. Everything seems watered down, including the sushi.  You will honestly find better quality at a Chinese buffet. Even the Edamame sucked. I swear people in Pittsburgh like to get fat off of terrible food.  Addendum: Had to edit my review half an hr out later, as my stomach felt terrible and I am vomiting. Go at your own risk.

J0W_tW5Y6sizX9jWTIh3NA.text: Nakama was a great date night for our anniversary. It was our first time there so we got a reservation, which I DEFINITELY recommend. There were definitely people waiting in line because they didn't make reservations. We chose not to get drinks but the people around us ordered drinks and said they loved them. We ordered a spicy California rolls for an appetizer and it actually came out really really fast. It was great. Then we got one chicken hibachi meal and one steak hibachi meal and we loved both. The steak was a tiny bit overcooked but not bad. The soup was a different kind of seasoning than I've had at other hibachi restaurants and so was the salad dressing, but both were good. I would say it is pricey, as are any hibachi places, but we got a significant amount of food for our money. I really loved it (outside of the AWFULLY RUDE guests that sat next to us and were mean to the waitress), but we would go back again. The only thing that turned me off about the restaurant was watching the amount of butter go into the rice and steak! Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Date night

-yH699qhfoQgZWhfuRHytw.text: Stopped by here today for food during OpenStreetsPGH! Prices are a little expensive but also sushi is usually expensive in general, especially at restaurants like these.  I got the dragon roll and my friend got the Hawaiian style roll. They were good but not anything spectacular. I think my check came out to around $16 for my one roll alone.   Service was really nice and attentive since they weren't super busy. However, the table we sat at had a spilled soy sauce puddle and a soaked menu. And the little side dishes for sauces were dirty and not cleaned well. It's disappointing because this seems like a "fancier" establishment that would focus on keeping their tables/dishes clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dragon roll
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hawaiian style roll

3_nwYwCXoa3fO0V7EKdVPQ.text: I've had much better sushi from a grocery store. Nothing interesting here. Very little Japanese feeling/taste to this restaurant.  Fortunately, my friend and I decided to do an appetizer to try out our favorite nigiri before ordering our main sushi. Instead of ordering more, we left. It was so not pleasing to our tastebuds. Two stars because at least we did not get sick from the appetizer.

NGQMviR_yt7BP6QCEN8sGA.text: First time going turned away at the door for having a black tank top on ...in the summer time for that matter. They offered me a "nakama chef coat" because I wasn't allowed to dine. There was no indication on there web site about a dress code and we traveled a far ways to go here for a date night. All in all, just really disappointed and felt slight offended.

wT28_XrMUroqAArN2mp0bw.text: They would get 5 stars because the food was good but the service was super slow. It was a Friday night and we had 3 different servers?? Two of them took our orders twice.. We had reservations at 8:00 and are just leaving now at 11:00. That's how slow. But the hibachi guy was awesome and the staff was friendly, just unorganized and incredibly snail-paced getting food out and filling water.   We went here for a friend's birthday. It was a surprise, but their policy is no seating until the entire party is there so we awkwardly had to surprise my friend sitting in separate groups at the bar lol

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xN50GIjT7wrnwIiqcBFsOQ.text: I've been to Nakama a few times for sushi (always delicious), but I finally got to try the hibachi .   The deal is pretty good -- you pick the protein (or veggies) and you get that, fried rice, salad, and a mini appetizer of (2) shrimp.  In addition to the hibachi scallops, I ordered the Nakama ceviche appetizer. When it arrived I was a bit thrown because, while it was a very pretty plate, it wasn't what I would call ceviche. Instead, it was a few large pieces of tuna sashimi on a bed of raw white onion, carrots, and I believe jicama. There wasn't much citrus flavor at all and the raw white onion was a bit too much. The tuna was delicious, but I would definitely change the name of the item.  The hibachi scallops were cooked perfectly, and the fried rice accompaniment was a little too good (I watched lots of butter go into it). Very yummy.  As far as the hibachi performance went, there wasn't much, though it was 12pm on a Saturday, so I get it. Our chef was very nice and kept up some good conversation with us. I also greatly enjoyed the fireball he started off with (see picture).

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nakama Ceviche

9XcdB0TMP1HaUA-THoN_Ww.text: Nakama was a lovely surprise for me. Even on a busy Saturday night, they seated our party right away (which was nice considering we had some late-comers) and were quick to get us drinks.  There was a huge variety of things ordered and everything (meat, seafood and vegetables) were all perfectly cooked and seasoned. Our hibachi chef was entertaining and the service was great.  ALWAYS get the fried rice upgrade.

R-UjGCVenAILRb60bSogAQ.text: My favorite hibachi place in Pittsburgh!  Nakama combines a great experience and atmosphere with delicious food and drinks.  I have never had a bad experience here.  The salad and mushroom soup they start you off with is better than any similar types I've had at other hibachi restaurants.  I love the ginger salad dressing and the great taste of the soup.  It is a great start to a great meal.  My go to meal here is the Hibachi Chateaubrind.  It is filet seared in a garlic butter.  I order mine medium rare and it is always cooked perfectly.  Each bite literally melts in your mouth and the flavor is out of this world.  The shrimp are also a delicious side to the meal.  I also find the rice at Nakama to just taste a little better than other spots.  Always look forward to my next trip back!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mDRZ7hA75LcI70lv9Kmhew.text: Okay, let me preface all of this by saying they'd get 5 stars if they weren't BLASTING 90's hip hop over the speakers. I get it, it's the south side. But on the same hand, it's a restaurant. Slow your roll. (See what i did there?)  I've had nakama bookmarked on Yelp for close to four years. I've always wanted to go, but never really made the time. Got asked on a date here, and couldn't turn it down. I love sushi.  So, this cant speak to the hibachi tables, but maybe someday it can.   Arrived at 8pm on Saturday for our reservation, and immediately were seated at a (wobbly) table by the window. We knew we were there for sushi, and we couldn't wait to get to ordering. They have paper sushi menus you can fill out with a little golf pencil and turn in like homework to make your sushi appear. We just kept checking boxes. Haha! So many amazing choices. Thanks to everyone who recommended the Hanalei Roll, it was amazing!   So the order went a little something like this; Spider Roll, Hanalei Roll, Pittsburgh Penguins Roll (much to the disappointment of my date did not contain penguin. KIDDING), Spicy Crab Salad Roll, and the Crunchy Philly Roll. When Leah, our server, brought them out we (and our little wobbly table) were a little overwhelmed. But we made it disappear quite quickly.   Neither one of us really liked the Penguins Roll. Seemed like it was just..missing something. The spider roll is forever my go to when trying new sushi. It was great. The Hanalei Roll, as previously stated was incredible. Who knew you could flash fry sushi?! The crunchy Philly Roll was about the same. Really good and disappeared quickly. My amazing date really enjoyed the spicy crab salad roll. Leah recommended it, and it was an excellent choice.   Everything was really great. No complaints on service, Leah made sure we had everything we needed quickly, and kept our water glasses full. Let's turn that music down a little bit, remember, this is Nakama, not Jimmy D's.   I will definitely be back. Hopefully WE will definitely be back.   Happy Eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spider Roll
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sushi on sushi on sushi.

_YA21upjaZ4zhb6uAxSPLw.text: Nakama was buzzing on Mother's Day, but we made reservations that was a easy breezy. As we waited in the bar area for the rest of my family to arrive, we were able to enjoy some beverages. Can't really rave too much, we only ordered beer and water...but it was cold!  Anyways, we were seated....let the show begin! Ok wait, they took our orders first and came out with our salads. I must say the salads were very tasty....loved the dressing. Yessss!!!! Ok...let the show begin!!!!!! We had so much fun with our cook, with his slicing and dicing skills. He was even giving me food, that I didn't order...he said come on just try it. I said ok....sure! And it was tasty! I did order the chicken, veggie, and rice hibachi....extra sauce please. Oh the sauce is to die for!!!! Ahhhmazing! He did a cute little hat fire trick. I must admit that I was a little nervous for himself and possibly our lives too. But we didn't need to call the fire department. It was my 2 year old nephew first time at a hibachi restaurant and he was very entertained.  Overall the experience was great, as well as the food. I think next time, I want to do a girls night out here. So much fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I like to soak my food in the yum yum sauce.
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hibachi chicken, vegetables, shrimp, and white rice. Yummy!
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hibachi shrimp and white rice

yFGw9EKHuAubuOcaTvzlmQ.text: I have heard Nakama referred to as the best sushi in Pittsburgh far too many times. It's not AWFUL, but it's nowhere near the top of the list. Umi, Andy's and Yamato in Monroeville, just to name a few off of the top of my head, all blow them away. The atmosphere is nice. It's your average hibachi restaurant. I would never go there specifically for the sushi. I have been to all of the locations, including the booth at PPG Paints arena, and it's consistent. Actually... the booth at PPG is sort of awful.

M1V8M_mJM6iOwJHKAueXSw.text: I really like Nakama and I've been here several times. I am surprised the ratings aren't better actually. I think it's a good place to get good sushi and hibachi. I've never had any of the other food so I can't speak for anything else. I've never had a bad experience but have also never been blown away by anything crazy.  Seating is available at the sushi counter, bar, hibachi table and dining room. It gets very busy and crowded on weekends so I recommend a reservation if you have a larger group.  It can get loud as well especially in the evening on weekends so I wouldn't come here during that time if you want a quiet and intimate environment.  Overall a good choice in my opinion and I will be back at some point.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

8WBzD5XJrC3J9Gz6K-20WQ.text: A Pittsburgh staple Nakama... everyone has been here so let's review it.... sitting on Carson street it has a cool location.. sushi bar and alcohol bar in front hibachi in Back.. I always get hibachi since I don't like sushi.. it's good I prefer Ichiban over Nakama though.. more flavorful.. I really like the spicy chicken egg rolls available here.. I always get fried rice but next time I'm going to try steamed for a lighter meal

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4yNP5uEytf_TjbCd8Og75g.text: I'm usually not a fan of hibachi in general, but I see why Nakama is a favorite for most. Authentic tasting asian hibachi cuisine and atmosphere make this place a sure bet. Conveniently located on the corner of Carson and 18th, Nakama is a popular destination for those looking for sushi and the famous hibachi-grilled meals.   I opted out of the hibachi specials, but my date ordered the sesame chicken and was quite pleased. Don't be alarmed by the higher than usual prices, the portions can feed 2-3 easily. The sushi was prepared well, although it came out after our meals were already served.   In the past, I've had less than desirable experiences, but this go around, I had no complaint. Great food and good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

enBBt895HjPxbXX1oTBpBw.text: I have to share only because I hadn't realized. Nakama has really gone downhill since my last visit. We stopped in for drinks and appetizers and were sorely disappointed. We ordered the lettuce wraps and the chicken was ground instead of actual chicken. We also ordered shrimp egg rolls and they came greasy and veggie only.  The cherries in our drinks tasted like they were marinated in jet fuel and my Planters Punch was poorly assembled in a rocks glass instead of a hi-ball with no pineapple flavor at all.  So sad to see a Pittsburgh place go so low.

nx2eeRqCvF7bFu_TguwdnA.text: Came here with my friend who's local and she introduced me to this amazingly delicious place. I ordered the tropical roll and she had a tempura Philly cheese roll. We share crab fritters and had a glass of wine with it. Everything was so delicious! I loved every minute of my experience there. The waiter was super attentive and friendly. The food was quick and fresh. I will most definitely return again in the near future.

C4j5szoGxqrjv_OvzzCXOA.text: Love their sushi there although if you call when they are busy you can not order take out... I dunno the reason , not enough staff... it's crazy any other time they are right one it taking your money...

l4uVJIgOMac8aguzqnA6mw.text: Lively atmosphere and great service.  Cocktails were tasty.  Sushi rolls were very tasty and fresh. Really enjoyed the food. We enjoyed the experience and will be back!!!

nAr6e8RUpdFiW23sc9bwdA.text: Bland food no showmanship no conversation my noodles were still cold. . . Probably the worst hibachi I have ever experienced. . .I definitely do not recommend it

vPoDOq4tnfvfpwnJVBO0sg.text: Pretty disappointing experience. Terrible service, mediocre food and unhospitable management. Will not return and would not recommend

qvLrMUQlVMpsrNaPYID57w.text: Love this place! Soup is delicious ...sake bomb...awesome.... Hibachis always great...go for lunch ...much cheaper less packed

qAR-jvzrXL4MG01M4ld9Ug.text: The 3 stars is strictly for the Laura the bartender and the daytime atmosphere, not the food.  I've been to Nakama a handful of times, though only once was it specifically for food. The rest of the time it was for a few drinks or some sake because it was a nice day out and I like sitting near their windows. I've never ordered a specialty drink, only beer and sake. Tip: if you go and like sake, get the Crazy Milk and check out the bottle for a few lulz.  We've ordered food twice, I believe, one time being referenced above when it was a full meal and the order was just some sushi for tapas-style appetizers. Neither time has the food impressed me. In fact, it's probably the worst sushi I have ever had. My boyfriend ordered a spicy tuna roll and the tuna looked like baby food, as if someone had chewed it up and spit it back out - no lie. It was disgusting, but he powered through most of it as he was starving. They also managed to mess up fried rice, completely annihilating the veggies for some reason. The sushi rolls I've ordered have ranged from "eh" to "gross."  I can't give this place less than 3 stars, though, because every time I've gone I've had a really great time. I guess I would break down my review like this: Food - 1 star, Atmosphere - 4 stars, Service - 4 stars.

b-3K93H0N_omuprYbf6k3Q.text: I've been to Nakama three times...each time worse than the last...shame on me for continuing to go...but there is an absolute dearth of places to go in Pittsburgh.    I had a reservation on Opentable; they cancelled the reservation but didn't fail to accept my money.  The server was beyond untrained.  They forgot at least three of the items we ordered.  We brought our own wine and they charged us a $30 corkage fee when the last time I was there they charged us $15.  I asked to speak to the manager who got angry that the last person hadn't charged us $30...that is THE HIGHEST CORKAGE FEE IN PITTSBURGH...and at a tired, mediocre restaurant.    I don't right negative reviews...I realize places have, like people, bad days...but it's clear this restaurant is on a precipitous slide from the peaks of mediocrity to much worse.  STAY AWAY!!!

akl1rDRY4OGKa-cRzZqb3g.text: I really do love Nakama. The food is delicious & something about watching it made & set out on your plate is a good feeling.. Everything is so fresh. I live when the cons do their little tricks. I do feel like they have made the portions smaller & I wish they gave you the extra mushrooms & the end.

JCddZyUzsTz8TvTvpVprWw.text: Went here with my son and decided to sit bar side! My son ordered shrimp hibachi I ordered chicken fried rice. My son got his food and finished and and I still had not gotten my rice! When I mentioned it to the waiter she said it'll be right out! 5min passed and she walks back by and says your rice will be right out! When I finally got my rice it was Nasty burnt sticky unflavored! Not one time did the waitress apologize for any mix up!!!! Never again and I visit this place every time I come to Pittsburgh drone Orlando Florida!!!

RWWz8gghZq3dVyO29q7m_w.text: Honestly nothing special compared to other hibachi places. The most recent time I went I had to ask for a box twice, sat and waited for awhile when everyone else in my party left, still didn't receive the box after the waiter visited the table next to me two more times to suck up while delivering the checks, so finally got up and left. I probably won't be back - just not worth how average it is.

wGkZn_rj-3me-qXVlng9LQ.text: I've been here many times, and I do think the Hibachi is tasty, however, the service seems to get worse every time I'm here.  Server seemed very rushed, barely staying at the table for 1 minute to take orders.  Today, I had my 9 year old son with us.  He ordered a steak kids meal, which the menu states is steak, vegetables, rice, and ice cream for dessert.  He got no veggies (which I didn't even mention since he won't eat them anyway) but he ate all of his meal and was excited for ice cream.  The server never mentioned or brought it, so I asked, "he's supposed to get ice cream with his meal right?"  He says, "oh, let me check if we have any."  About 10 minutes later he comes back with our check and says, "sorry we're out of ice cream." My son says, "do you have any other dessert?" Server says, "No, but the Milkshake factory is a few doors down."  Really?!?!?  Your solution to being out of something is referring me to another establishment down the street?  Is Nakama buying him a milkshake? Otherwise, I don't know, but that just seems ridiculous to me.  He acted as if I was trying to get some freebie or something.  It says it comes with the meal.  At least offer the kid a pineapple or take a drink off the check or something.  No, I did not take it up with the manager because at this point I just wanted to get out of there.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The menu.
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2fqxZ7nWDNvEuPZtkVFq3A.text: Went for lunch with my friend. We sat at the Hibachi table and had the best time. We come here regularly but today was exceptionally awesome because of our chef's upbeat personality and witty jokes the whole time. Our chef, Luke, was entertaining as well as cooked everything perfectly. Would request his table again in the future. Also ordered a Philly roll, which are always delicious here. The veggie egg roll we got was actually pretty disgusting. It was so oily and tasted bitter. I told the waitress and she gladly removed from my bill. Other than that, lunch was great.

7sRQHCb52OK4t7OGVVPwsA.text: If they had 4.5 stars, I would rate them higher than 4. This place is rad! It gets really busy, so I highly recommend reservations or sitting at the bar. Don't pay attention to the 3 star review because this place deserves more than that! Service is great and one of the great things about sitting at the bar is you can watch them make your roll right there in front of you. We ordered 3 different rolls and each one was fresh, unique, and on point. Give it a shot!

1tms1luWrz6v454q-HeARg.text: I like hibachi but I forgot how expensive the fancy stuff were. With that in mind and my budget, I decided to get an assortment of sushi rolls and a signature cocktail. The sushi and coconut shrimp were great, but the cocktail was just a tease. It honestly tasted like juice. Maybe the light up ice cube was placed to detract you from the lack of alcohol.

VqZ_R3lpm3miwr-3MqCjkA.text: From the service to the food everything is great. One of my favorite places in the city.

I4ZObus7bh0Eya4CA3nHvQ.text: Seafood Lovers Dream. Everything I tried  is absolutely fantastic. Great Atmosphere. Been going there for year. Totally gave up on Benihanna..since their head chef "Ron" left for Nakama. VIP CUSTOMER.

kHKzfdXGednFFeLqso91JA.text: I'm definitely a Nakama fan!  Whenever I'm trying to think of a place to go for dinner for a special occasion or a night out, Nakama often comes to mind! We usually get the hibachi dinner and it's always delicious and fun to watch!  We usually get some sushi too!  I live in LA now, so I've definitely had some good sushi out here, but I think the sushi at Nakama is just as good.   My biggest complaint about this place is that it's way overpriced.  They charge you for all of these little extra things too, like fried rice, which I feel is pretty unnecessary.  The sushi is also overpriced in my opinion.  Overall though, I've always had a great time at Nakama and I love the food!  I would definitely recommend it!

RO1CkfAEJA_PBrse6bHfsg.text: It's good. The rolls are better than the sashimi although one time we had some really nice(and surprising) maguro. We always get the hamachi jalapeno roll and some sashimi so don't get me wrong when I say the rolls are better than the sashimi. It's still enjoyable. Good atmosphere and my girl likes the martinis. Little Tokyo in Mt. Lebanon and Kiku in Station Square are better. Nakama is good for some enjoyable sushi and, more importantly, the atmosphere.  You can go here and watch the pens game AND eat a roll.  Can't say that about a lot of sushi restaurants.  4.5 of 10 relative to sushi quality alone

bX6RJvydmBoU6ek27q5wkg.text: Great for a birthday celebration. Great server and excellent cook! Had so much fun  and food was amazing. Had the veggie option and everything was cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Volcano!!

hi-3lZqeWgc7uyvCm-rLrw.text: everybody knows this place and it's an upscale destination for a night out.  whether hibachi, sushi, or bar crowd, you're bound to find what you came for.  is it the best sushi in the world?  nah, good but overrated.  but.... that's not really the sale here.  the sale is the atmosphere and in that sense, it usually delivers.

fqqt1eCYzTm8QQfOXB35Xg.text: Disclaimer: This is review is for the SUSHI BAR ONLY   Went here last Saturday and stopped in for a quick bite at the sushi bar, mainly to try it out because I've heard so many good things about Nakama.   To be honest, my experience was exactly like the two star Yelp rating means: Meh. I've experienced better.  Two of the 4 rolls I ordered were loosely made which as a sushi lover I found to be kinda unacceptable. One had an end piece that frankly would have gotten the sushi chef a failing grade by anyone's standards - it was falling apart and had nothing but rice and paper on it despite this being a fairly pricey signature roll. One of my sushi pieces was similarly falling apart - the rice hadn't been packed enough and the salmon was just slapped on there.   I would even have sent those back if I could have found a waitress or been able to hear myself think. They were just too crowded to give the proper amount of love to each dish, and as you know, a dish prepared without love is bound to be lacking.  The noise and my seat in relation to the crowded door area just made me want to get out of there. I was bumped several times by people weaving their way past each other, at one point someone bumped my elbow as I was raising a cup of hot sake. Hmm ... a splash of hot sake? ... let's say it's not my favorite sensation in the crotch area.  Anyway, the staff was friendly when you were able to flag someone down and I am sure everyone was doing their best, but think this place is highly overrated - making it over crowded - making the whole experience that much less enjoyable for everyone.  Hope your experience is better than mine - the place should have been better from what I've been told by Nakama fans. Good luck!!

MJxcuVSCYY5SCh6vCllZlA.text: Large selection of premium sushi and sashimi.  This time around I tried the Philadelphia roll and Spicy Tuna roll. Both are some of the cheaper options on their menu, but you get 8 medium-sized pieces in these rolls, so it's a decent value. The tuna roll wasn't spicy at all. Like, I could taste a little spiciness if I focused, but it definitely wasn't what I expected. Similarly, I couldn't taste the smoked salmon very much in the Philadelphia roll.  The spicy chicken appetizer, however, was appropriately spicy. It's also a cheaper option (being an appetizer) and it's half off for happy hour, which makes it a fantastic value. I would definitely get the chicken again.  I also got to try some of the more expensive sashimi that my friends ordered, and they are definitely worth the price. They were noticeably bigger than the budget rolls I ordered and came with good sauces and a big chunk of fish on top.  Overall, this restaurant is actually a pretty good value for a fancier sushi spot. They have a dress code which isn't terribly strict, but definitely helps set some expectations. And their food is certainly higher quality. But their prices aren't outrageous.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Tuna Roll (background) Phil&#39;s delphia Roll (foreground)

-nw3wdB0VOrlj2CRR_uDgw.text: Absolutely one of the most overrated and incredibly overpriced restaurants in town. The sushi wasn't even as good as giant eagle, enough said. The silverware looked like it was from the dollar store. The service was terrible, the bartender didn't know or care about any of our questions. They have no hot sauces, spices etc  They have no hot mustard for the egg rolls, the manager offered a packet of garbage mustard that was probably several years old for 2 egg rolls that cost $8 , please... Some of the foods on the menu were not available. The restaurant was filthy. We won't be going there ever again, we would give it a zero rating if we could.

eo3wGOhZboqUzaUR61DLFQ.text: This is a review of their food truck -   The food truck is at my apartment complex today and I am less than satisfied with the food. I ordered the spicy lo mein ahi tuna. The tuna was ok. It came from a food truck so it was in line with that, the noodles however were disgusting. They were incredibly chewy like they came from one of those microwaveable noodle boxes but they forgot to put them in the microwave. I ate the tuna off the top and threw the rest away - completely disappointed.

2f8Ojzf3PQA6qvqrVnll-w.text: Just an update on my review....still 5 stars for me. I ate here with about 8 coworkers one evening after work, and everyone did a fantastic job! Our waiter, Julian, was amazing. I didn't realize they closed at 10, and everyone in our party didn't arrive until basically 9. I felt bad, and was nervous they would rush us and be annoyed....exactly the opposite. Julian was hilarious, attentive, and allowed us To take our time without ever making it obvious we were the only ones left in the restaurant at one point. Our chef also did a Fantastic job, everything was fresh and cooked to order! I love nakama and will continue to always come back.

5rwaJnIXTS09k8vUDR-XxA.text: Came with friends to Nakama for dinner and drinks. I LOVE their hibachi Chateaubriand. It is sooooooo delicious and always cooked so well. It's a great serving at a great price for how amazing the steak is. It's a fun typical hibachi restaurant where you can get a meal and a show (cooked in front of you). I personally always sit by the bar and order my hibachi there. The drinks are great and it's a slightly fancier vibe for the southside side. They have great sushi options and quick service. They offer a rewards card that keeps track of points for your visits which is great too!  They have a decent happy hour with specials on drinks and food. I always have a great meal and a great time! And it's so easy to hit up local bars afterwards.

f197m6n5N1qmpqYDf3I0yQ.text: We eat here a few time a month for lunch. The price is right nice Portion of food the hibachi is excellent The sushi is always fresh great beer on tap always a pleasure to eat here   recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dragon roll

zPQg1fwgNqikYFk4O-2ZRA.text: Love me some nakama ! Pgh favorite in my eyes - anywhere from habachi to ordering apps and drinks at the bar, never a bad experience . Food is delicious , they're always busy which says a lot . I've come here for years and it's always a top choice in the south side .

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sake bombs!!!

sUJnlP2U7PIDlDlEqAs0Xg.text: First of all myself and my wife love hibachi grills. We decided to venture here for our anniversary for a nicer-than-normal dinner.   Upon pulling up on the side street in front of Nakama there is a valet that takes your car. It is worth it as there is not much parking along Carson Street or around it.   Entering the restaurant you are greeted by the bar and a hostess. At first glance the restaurant seems to have great natural light, but that quickly dissipates when you enter the hibachi grill section. It is poorly lit with minimal lighting. It was very hard to us to read our menus and I even had to pull out my phone to use the flashlight. (Makes me seem like I'm old). Once we ordered our appetizer and our dinners, the waiter seemed to be running around 2 other tables, and stopped at our table only twice during the whole time we were there; once to pick up our salad and soup dishes, and the second time to pick drop off/pick up our checks.  Dinner was ok. Ok in the food was over salted and the chef didn't seem into it at all while cooking. I ordered the three course dinner which included steak, chicken, and shrimp and for the price I recieved a ton of chicken, a decent bit of steak, but tiny shrimps. I exchanged the steamed rice with the Udon noodles which I thought ok a couple of dollars charge, but they charged almost $7 for some noodles. Maybe it was just me but I thought that was outrageous.   Overall, if you are looking for good food at a decent price, this is not it. They upcharge for all add-ons pretty heavily and you are better off going to another hibachi grill.

Bw9fN6QgZ6EURqRjrlJiag.text: I loved Nakama. I still love the sushi. But today I went for lunch to use my birthday coupon. I got two spicy California rolls and a scallops lunch. And there was something different. There wasn't any veggies. I asked " I didn't get my veggies."  NO more veggies with lunch ~ worker replies. It seems like every time I come something has changed. Either they canceled late night happy hour, smaller bowls and plates and now no veggies with lunch. Very disappointed. Waitress wasn't very good either. I'll have to go to Wexford's location where my favorite waitress went to. P. S. Sushi was still great. ( Bring back late night happy hour!)

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No Veggies?!

xWOdM2OUPeIjkegAbERFVQ.text: Nakama has really gone down hill over the years. When I lived in Pittsburgh last time, Nakama was THE place to go for a special occasion or a delicious sushi roll date.  We've been twice since moving back... and both times disappointed. The first time, we went for sushi and sat at the sushi bar. The sushi was underwhelming but we thought maybe we were being too harsh since we were used to the fresh fish of Florida.   The second time we went back, we had a lovely waitress whose name now escapes me. We had a reservation but it was incredibly slow. We ended up having an entire table for just the two of us! We ordered our meals, and of course I asked for mine to be cooked gluten free. There was some sort of confusion between the waitress and the chef that led the chef to speak to her in a horrible demeanor right in front of us. It made me feel bad for ordering. After a conversation with the manager, waitress and chef - he finally proceeded to make our meal. He refused to use the gluten free soy sauce and I even tried to hand it to him. It was a horrible experience, and he made me feel uncomfortable even eating my meal.  The manager stopped by again to check on us and we explained what a horrible experience it was overall. First, the chef berated the waitress in front of us. Then, he refused to make our meal the agreed upon way. The manager did comp our meal, and the two stars here are for the manager and server!  I will never come back here again though for the way the chef treated the server and myself. On a positive note, I did go home and doctor up my food with gluten free soy sauce to add some flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Naruto  Maguro Roll and mango Mango Tango Tuna
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spider Roll and another one!

WJqoqFYL5AbIW2EECqrN8w.text: Love this spot. One of PITTSBURGHs best places you may otherwise overlook if your out of town. Great sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Saki bombs and some beers
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Saki shots with a beverage. Sunday funday with my wife !

JoJ-GSsHfcIIMy2g3GFUkQ.text: Great food but awful service.   We sat at the bar on a Friday night, and it was surprisingly not busy at all. If it had been busy, though, at least that would have been a good excuse for the terrible service.   There were 3 bartenders working, but they were more concerned with the conversations amongst themselves than with taking our order or checking in on us. Once we finally got our order taken, they forgot what we had ordered, and we had to ask again.   We had three sushi rolls which were all amazing, but unfortunately not worth the awful service that we experienced.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

39l2uDgVWwUYfRf_pH2Aag.text: Very good meal and fun atmosphere. Hibachi is always fun for a function. I had the lettuce wraps and Hibachi chicken and I loved it. Huge portions ! I recommend this restaurant !

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy lettuce wraps and sushi roll
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. No more eyebrows:)

5jD5vU2gBdIeAqq011RwDg.text: I noted that a lot of the reviews were negative due to poor service. However, our chef/hibachi guy was excellent. He was funny, skilled, and made for a great experience! The lunch special was a good deal, and I even had leftovers the next day. The food was delicious as well. The only scary thing was being able to see how much butter was used!! Overall, Nakama had a great atmosphere ranging from a group of friends, business luncheon, or family. I would definitely recommend this to anyone, and I will be back. Side-note, I also hear their food truck is amazing, but I've never tried it because the lines are always very long.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

oox6ocMd6xamJVis7KLyZw.text: The bartenders were extremely slow and untrained. A lot of time ignoring customers to chat with regulars.  The beer was warm and they tried keeping some beers glasses on deck with ice to help with temperature, that did little to he  Dinner was ok. Ok in the food was over salted with an over abundance of soy sauce. I ordered egg rolls and discussed the lack of sauces with the waiter. The egg rolls never came And when asked if he remembered me ordering them, initially he said "nope" and then "oh yeah, my bad" and walked away.   We were a party of 12 so either way he was getting 18% tip. The attitude he displayed did not warrant 18%.

vH1xT7NXQCD5X4UFwiD-Mw.text: This review is for the food truck!    Overpriced for poor quality food. I got the lo mein with chicken.  The chicken was bland and the noodles were just that, noodles.  Nothing great about it.  They give it to you already in a boat with foil over it so you can't see it and therefore can't complain.   My stomach hurts already!

vAW5K7R6wSzlS0Sa05Gt_Q.text: -Service was slow and disorganized. Maybe it was because it was a busy night, but we waited a long time for a drink order and food order. The food came out relatively normal- but for a sushi restaurant, I expect it to be quicker.  - The food is just OK. The sushi was not great- it was kind of falling apart and the flavors were just not fresh and vibrant. It was almost bland. I did really enjoy the chicken lettuce wraps they offer, but the Gyoza I ordered was almost chicken pot pie like...?  -The atmosphere is good here- perhaps I had a somewhat poor experience because I sat at the sushi bar which created confusion. Perhaps the habatchi service/bar area they offer will provide more positive tones.  -The atmosphere is lively and the location is in the heart of Southside. But based on my experience, chances are I will not be revisiting Nakama in the near future.

oy26KgghLx1koohq1bVgDg.text: A fun hibachi place on Carson St in the South Side. Service is a little spotty at times, but portions are generous and the hibachi chefs are quietly gregarious. Unlike some other places, Nakamura offers spicy sauce - it isn't particularly spicy, but it adds a tiny kick, which is helpful Zac since hibachi rarely has much flavor, if any.

photos.caption: Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The fun of hibachi
Photo of Nakama - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The fun of hibachi

OFtvpgid27HGet4mn3yacQ.text: We had dinner here with 7 people and a baby on Friday night.  I think my review is pretty similar to everyone else's...  Food was AWESOME. Service was EHHH.  The sushi was the best I have had - especially in Pittsburgh.  My husband got a white tuna roll and it was AMAZING.  The hibachi was also very tasty - my filet was cooked perfectly and the fried rice is worth the upcharge.  The service however - ehhhhh.  Our waitress was slow and not interested in refilling drinks or taking more bar orders.  Asking for an extra fork or plate 2-3 times and still not getting it till the meal was over.  Just things like that...  But I would suffer the service for the food!  So tasty!!!!!

dUCe0ZdBVulEfO4Y5IRV9g.text: This place was fantastic! Not only was it fun, the food was delicious! The place was very busy for a Friday night as it is most people's night out or date night.  During this evening, I ordered shrimp tempura roll.  My choice of drink was a pina colada. The drink was okay, I wouldn't go there for the drinks but the appetizer was delicious. I loved my hibachi meal, bobs favorite triple combo, in which you would get chicken, shrimp, and steak along with rice and veggies.   This meal was amazing. Definitely an intimate setting outside of hibachi tables can also be reserved if you do not want to watch your food be cooked before you.   Tip: ask for extra rice and you can have extra yumminess to enjoy the next day as your left overs.

3z028lC7YoZ1ce-k2whkqw.text: Cherry blossom sushi roll. Need I say anymore?! Well besides the edamame with Siracha and miso soup.. I just can't get enough sushi from the place. I have no complaints about the hibachi but I find myself at nakama strictly for my cherry blossom roll. Mmm. Sushi. Oh and sake bombs. God bless the sake bombs...

y9VmGIvus-U3SoCsNFGZ6w.text: Nakama is my go-to for special occasions! Hibachi is great with all kinds of land and sea options to choose from.  Sushi is also just spectacular with so many different choices! However, being that nakama is in the Southside - where all the bars and club scenes are, it may seem like more of a bar type environment rather than a sushi and hibachi restaurant.  Reasoning why it doesn't get a full 5 stars is due to how expensive it can be! Dinner for 2,  a person can easily spend 60-70$ during dinner time.  That's why I like to hit the lunch time special where it's half the price - but also half the food but you still get your hibachi fix!

v4iqtS3G23Oh9Abp2VKa6w.text: I know how many people seem to rave about Nakama... I really do not understand it.  As a young professional, I am offended at the lack of cheese and desperation in this place on any given weekend.  Is anyone themselves anymore?  Are people that desperate to keep up fake appearances and be someone that they are not?  That is the vibe that I get in this place.  Sorry to those who love it, but I know for certain I am not the only one who feels this way.  Sushi here is mediocre at best... I have had way better elsewhere (and I cannot believe I am going to say this- even Cleveland had many way better sushi options that Pittsburgh!- I love this city but we are lacking in options!).  If you sit at the bar or sushi bar, you will leave smelling like a Hibachi as well (wish there was something that they could do about this- if people want to stink, they would sit at the Hibachi tables I am sure).  Service is meh... I have had one great server the many times I have been there (I was forced to have work dinners there based on customer demands way too often, and one of my friends loves this place for a quick dinner so I have been here a lot).  I recommend a martini here... they at least are good.  Other drinks have seemed pretty weak.    I wish I could say better things being a resident of the Southside who prefers to stay local on weekends, but I cannot.

5nWOWssDnWToWAmzFEI5Rw.text: I have been to Nakama for many happy hours in my earlier professional days. Recently, I arrived for sushi with my friend Katie around 7:30 PM on a Thursday (great downtime to get a seat at the bar following their popular happy hour). This was an impromptu outing after assisting Katie with some logistics for this year's Silk Screen Gala & Film Festival. We started with beverages and placed an order of edamame. They definitely place a good amount of sea salt on those green soy goodies, which I LOVE. Thursday is ladies night, which allows 1/2 off of a selection of mixed drinks, beers and/or house wines. Together, we surveyed the area, making up fun and comical stories about our fellow bar patrons. #Goodtimes Next, we placed our order for sushi (the main entree), cleansing our palates each with a salad. I had the Nakama salad with their yummy ginger dressing. Katie had a spectacular cucumber salad, mixed with soy sauce, sesame seeds and red pepper bites. Finally, the sushi arrived in its artistic and flawless state. Fresh and colorful, we each chose 2 types (totaling 4): Asparagus Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll, Baked Alaskan (our favorite), and a Hawaiian roll. Nakama has a moderate to high price point which makes sense, due to their prime location in Pittsburgh's South Side neighborhood and terrific ambiance. I will definitely be going back. Oh, and knowing that we ate so healthy (minus the salt and soy sauce) made for a non-bloated ride home. #30somethingproblems Review can be found on my website as well: wp.me/p43vGR-YX

_2bXdZewQ7fTwC3Z3GNAYA.text: The sushi and hibachi are really good! I've been here a couple times and it's a nice place to have good food and some drinks

mO73qNZ1LIXttMm7MOhn3w.text: I like Nakama, but you need to be ready for more of a bar / party type experience.  The hibachi is good.  The food is good.  It really comes down to the chefs.  They have a couple chefs that put on a crazy good show.  If you get one of them, you are in luck.  They each seem to have their quirks.  It isn't the typical show of a little bit of flame and a shrimp tail in the hat.  The sushi bar and regular bar are where Nakama really shines.  Nakama has a great bar scene and good sushi.  The sushi isn't the best in the city, but it is well done.  The fish to rice ratio is great and they have a diverse selection of pretty sushi rolls for people who want to go beyond your standard single fish product and rice.  I'd strongly recommend Nakama if you want some good sushi and drinks in a upscale busy bar environment.  If you are looking for an 'authentic' sushi / hibachi experience, this is not the place.  Nakama fits the Southside scene.  You hit Nakama before a club or party bar.

0e4fglo-IkS95vbuMP0kYg.text: The three stars (really 3.5) is for the steak and chicken I ordered at the hibachi as I thought it was tender and seasoned well.  However, I didn't care for the fried rice I added on at all and there was a lot of waiting around.  It took an extremely long time to get any meat/protein.  Since it was cooked last you basically had to eat rice and vegetables if you wanted hot food or sit there and let your food get cold while you waited for the rest of it.  Initially I tried waiting for everything but it kind of got to the point of being ridiculous having food on the plate and just letting it sit there untouched for so long getting cold.

EUWfTUOhuhD4ko1DP6CuMA.text: Boy, has this place changed over the years! The price has always been steep, but it used to be that you would get great, fresh food, service and entertainment in return. Not anymore.   The wait staff is generally sour and unprofessional. We came in on a Monday afternoon and they clearly struggled to find hibachi seating arrangements during this slow period.   Luckily, on this Monday, we were able to get the one chef with a modicum of talent and personality. When Nakama first opened, all of the chefs were friendly and full of tricks. That's what we come for. The whole point of hibachi restaurants is to be entertained, not just sit around a sweaty table. Most of Nakama's chefs nowadays will just sit there in silence as they grill your steak.   The food is still good for the most part, although the sushi isn't very fresh, and they have a tendency to bring appetizers during or after your main course.   A lot has changed over the years. Between the loud music on weekends, reward cards, and specials, it's clear Nakama is trying to do too much instead of just concentrating on good hibachi. The bar makes a killing on weekends, though, so I doubt they'll change.   As an aside, they have a broken "gong" that they ring on your birthday, except that they deaden the noise, so it sounds like a fork hitting a table. Come on guys!

nMxj_YPjw5XrQm7Je6igtA.text: Been hearing about this place and love my sushi, so finally indulged myself.  It's a Friday evening about 6pm and the place is hopping with people and their energy (and noise level).  However, since I'm going solo tonight I have no problem finding a place at the sushi bar.  I'm tended to promptly and pleasantly by my server who helps me determine which tuna I would prefer for my sushi selection and lets me know it is very fresh tonight.  I end up with eel, salmon, and tuna plus a salad with ginger dressing and a glass of plum wine.    My server checks on me, the sushi chef at the sushi bar serves me my sushi and it is a nice portion and tastes very fresh and just the right serving temperature.  I'm a happy camper as I do love my sushi.  The price is in line with any sushi restaurant.  I spent about $32.00 plus tip for 6 pieces of sushi, a salad, and a glass of wine.  They do have the hibachi tables and usual fare and fanfare that goes with it.  Plusses:  No TV in the sushi bar and no salt and pepper shakers alongside the soy sauces.  :-)  Been seeing that a lot lately so was glad it wasn't the case here.  The only down side is the volume level of noise which I would attribute to poor acoustics, perhaps?  Not a problem for me dining alone but if I was with someone and wanted to carry on a conversation, I think there would have been a lot of "Huh?  What'd you say?;s".    I'd definitely come here again.

raM5fsaRgqRSVDmip7AU_g.text: Good sushi and sashimi. Miso soup was just ok. The Uni was delicious. The row with quail eggs was lacking some flavor. It's medium all the way around not great not bad. I loved the Carson St atmosphere.

Z-R2_2v8O0cGYnM_62aLsA.text: Went on a Monday at 8PM and the restaurant and Hibachi wasn't very crowded.  Monday also gives you $7 off the steak/chicken/shrimp dinner; which is a good deal.  I decided to try the restaurant again and my opinion stayed the same.  Onion soup is watery and not very good.  The salad dressing is not as good as other similar places.  The show is nothing special.    If you go to their website you can get a free appetizer coupon but you can't use with the daily special.  No valet on Mondays but many meters are on Carson St.

ZhBDrkEDqYXd2IaWM3gI_A.text: Don't go here if you are gluten free. Our server was pretty clueless and they couldn't prepare gf sushi. My food was cooked in the back, came out cold and I had half of what everyone else had. Had a reaction to my food. Def got glutened.  Also had to ask several times for water. My friend got the complete wrong sushi order.   Not a great time at all.

ka8EJYzhjwnrMXYyqjmEGg.text: Came here for the first and most definitely the last time the other day. Decided to come here after many coworkers had recommended the establishment, and was left highly disappointed. My friend and I sat down at the bar, and it took the bartender about ten minutes to come over. I ordered a beer and my friend wanted to taste it before ordering one herself. After dropping off my drink, the bartender walked away and didn't come back for another ten minutes to take my friends drink order. After dropping that one off, walked away for another twenty minutes before taking our food orders. When I ordered, I asked to modify my sushi order a little and her exact response was "whatever, you're eating it, not me", and when I ordered a dish, it was "oh that's my absolute favorite but we don't make it anymore". If it's on the menu, shouldn't it be available? I asked for the sushi first and said I would decide on a main course after that came out. The sushi came out, and the order was completely wrong. After it had been sitting there and I tried to flag her down, she came over (again, about 20 minutes later) and just threw it in the trash right in front of us. Rolled her eyes and told me that I should have "explained what I wanted". Having now spent an hour here, we had just wanted to pay for our beers and leave, no longer wanting food. When I spoke with the manager, all she said was "this is the first complaint I've ever gotten about her", and walked away. Wish I could give zero stars just based off of the terrible service.

VBS6woG9FHO9yzp3XC0D2Q.text: Here's a little story about why I won't be going to Nakama again. We were eating our dinner when a group of women came in to eat. They had all been at the pool all day and had dried out in the sun and were ready for some Sushi. I heard them all talking about how this was their favorite place and they have birthday celebrations there all the time. The manager approached them and told one girl in particular that she had to "cover herself." She said, "I'm wearing a cover-up and shorts." To this, he left them be and they sat at the bar. They order a full meal and are waiting on their drinks. The manager approaches the group of women again and says, "You have to cover yourself up or I'll have to ask you to leave." She is mortified and confused. Her friends say to him, "She'll make sure that it's buttoned all the way. Is that ok?" He says that isn't acceptable because you can still tell there is a swimsuit under the shirt. While this was True, it was no more revealing than being able to see the outline of a bra through a blouse. BUT THAT'S NOT EVEN THE POINT. "You have to cover yourself or I'll have to ask you to leave." Now I know you can't sit in a restaurant wearing only a swimsuit. And these women knew that, too. They were prepared with shorts, wraps, skirts, dresses, everything. One friend asked him what would happen if a woman came in with a shirt that was meant to be sheer, what would he do? No response. "You'll have to cover yourself or I'll have to ask you to leave." At this point, the woman's friends decide they have had enough humiliation from this man and decide they will take their business elsewhere. A few other patrons who have not yet ordered show their support and leave as well. The woman sits with her cover-up wrapped around her and says, "I would like to finish my water, and then I will leave." Cool as a cucumber. Her friends wait for her outside as she finishes her water. The police walk in. THE POLICE. He called the police on a woman who was fully clothed with a swimsuit underneath her shirt who was quietly drinking water. The Policemen tell the girl to wait outside with her friends and they'll see what's going on. They talk with the manager and then meet the women outside. As we leave, I tell the group that I am so sorry they had to deal with that humiliation. I hear the policeman say, "You can't take it personally. Call corporate if you feel it was inappropriate." Truly trying to be polite and understanding. But here's the thing. Please don't tell a woman who is being publicly punished for having a body not to take it personally. They were fully clothed. They were not wet. They were not causing a problem. They just happened to be a group of women dressed for summer.  This was my first time here, and I can also get better sushi at Jade Grille in Mt. Lebo. And our plates for the soy sauce were filthy. So there's ALSO that.

DFBwPebOwgkYo2mataomrw.text: I'm not sure if Susan is the worst bartender in the world but she ruined my night. If this is typical for Nakama's service I will never be back. I wish I could give 0 stars. I have never posted a review before but feel so strongly about her terrible service that I just had to.

9AFvzxv8B7DznFZF5tb30g.text: They've gotten better. It's still location, location, location. I can't blame them for charging the prices they do- people are paying it and leaving happy.

I7g4OGVQO9SFmkxr3W7whA.text: Best fried rice I've ever had!! I love it so much. It's my favorite restaurant in Pgh. Every time I visit, I have to go.

diUIxQVA5TzEuWNX1hhzaw.text: Hmm...rarely do I return and reduce my rating....never actually. But, this time, I have no choice. The sushi was still good (again, for the area and what we have available to us) and we tried some of our friend's hibachi and the steak was really good - hence the reason I'll still give three stars. This time, I ordered my beloved strawberry citrus-tini martini. While the drink itself was the same, the rim didn't have the same amazing blue sugar. And....there was some sort of hair or something of some sort in my drink...that I discovered AFTER drinking some of the drink. I'm still grossed out by it. Can I, will I return? I'm not so sure.

ZpjG4Y0M_UMhGpdHflUcyQ.text: The food here is soooooooo GROSS NOW!!! Don't eat here... The chef SUCKX
